characters: THREE SHIPS ON A BOUNDLESS OCEAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We start on a man's elegant slipper.  He is seated in a splendid chair.  Moving up the stocking leg, we pass the garter of Castile, coming to rest on a pair of delicate hands.  His fore finger impatiently plays with a large topaz ring.  Over this, we hear distant footsteps, echoin on marble floors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Castilian face:  aquilaine profile, olive complexion, dark eyebrows and meticulously sculpted beard.  This is TREASURER SANCHEZ. A door slams somewhere, the footsteps getting closer.  We can now here a subdued conversation. TREASURER SANCHEZ stands up as: The door opens at the far end of the large gilded room. A WOMEN, magnificent in somber taffeta, enters.  QUEEN ISABEL OF SPAIN moves towards him. He bows slightly as she sits at the end of the large table.  She is followed by a PRIEST, BROTHER BUYL, and three dignitaries of Church and State. All sit beside her.  TREASURER SANCHEZ takes a document and starts to read aloud. On screen the words:  GRANADA - SPAIN - 1500

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Majesty would wish to know the true facts concerning the island of Hispanola, our first settlement in the New World, and the activities there of your servant, Christopher Columbus, Admiral of the Ocean Sea, Governor of that Island.  You will remember with what hopes and promises he beguiled us -- the truth is that he now presides over a state of chaos, degradation and madness beyond imagining.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SANCHEZ punctuates each word carefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the beginning, Columbus proved himself incapable of managing the affairs of the island.  He appointed his brothers to important positions, at once injuring the pride and dignity of the nobles who had gone with him.  He promised to build a city, the City of Isabel, named after Your Majesty.  What he actually built was nothing but a collection of huts, and that in the wrong place, for all of it was easily swept away by rain and mud. Is that not so, Brother Buyl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PRIEST nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Your Honor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He promised gold.  Not finding the easy quantities he promised, Columbus commanded each Indian to pay an annual tribute.  Most being unable to, they were barbarously punished, against the express wish of Your Christian Majesties...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ISABEL lowers her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since provocation and injustice never ceases, many of the Indians have fled to the forests, or have begun to slay the Christians.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ISABEL looks over at BROTHER BUYL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could it be so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Your Majesty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there is worse.  From the beginning, he forced the nobles to undergo physical labor, treating them equally with the Indians, all of them reduced to slavery.  When the nobleman Adrian de Moxica protested against such treatment... (he pauses) ... he was executed. (pause) Is that not true also, Brother Buyl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Your Honor.  It is all true. All of it.  I saw it with my own eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has lost control.  His great arrogance has led him into depravity.  He encourages our soldiers to marry the native women. He promised a paradise, but he has made a hell full of all its horrors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that the man I knew, Treasurer Sanchez?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Your Majesty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON the FACE:  COLUMBUS is stretched on a bed, sweating heavily in fever, clearly delirious.  Insects crawl over his face, he makes no effort to swat them away There is a dripping sound of water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of all the words my Father wrote and there were many, I remember these the most.  "Nothing that results from human progress is achieved with unanimous consent..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rain is falling into the room over documents spread on a table.  COLUMBUS stands up and moves to the table.  Some of the walls have been blackened with smoke and flames. lizard scuttles into the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "And those who are enlightened before the others are condemned to purse that light in spite of others..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS stares down at the documents, moving them away from the rain drips.  He stares out by the window, and we see: A devastated landscape.  Flooded roads, half-destroyed huts, broken trees... A dog picks its way through the mud

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was a time when the New World didn't exist...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A vast stretch of ocean.  It fills the screen.  Unbroken, infinite, luminous, mysterious -- it stretches away, meeting and blending with the sky in pale ribbons of pear and misty light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... The sun set in the west on an ocean where no man had dared to venture.  And beyond that, infinity...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pulling back, we discover: A TEN-YEAR-OLD BOY and a strongly built man in his middle thirties, are riding a mule.  The MAN'S weather-beaten face frames unusually bright eyes. On the screen these words:  ANDALUSIA, 1491 COLUMBUS AND HIS SON are following a windthrashed path at the top of the hill.  COLUMBUS hums a song, and FERNANDO looks up at him in adoration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once I asked my Father where he wanted to go.  And he replied:  "I want to travel all over the seas.  I want to get behind the weather..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FERNANDO laughs.  He then starts to hum along with his FATHER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rugged landscape, remote and steep, with lines of stone walls and thousands of sheep. FERNANDO, rushes down a slope, barking like a dog, chasin the sheep who fan out in droves in front of him.  High- spirited and wild, FERNANDO laughs and tumbles over. COLUMBUS rides his mule along the narrow track, watching his SON'S antics with amusement.  In the distance, the solitary figure of A MONK SHEPHERD. COLUMBUS calls out to his son:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fernando!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FERNANDO runs over.  COLUMBUS lifts him up onto the mule. As they move along the track we now see, perched on a distant hill, isolated and austere, the Monastery of La Rabida, their destination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they dismount and walk into the quiet cloisters, FERNANDO suddenly spots a familiar FIGURE, standing under the ROMAN arches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diego!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rushes over, full of joy, to kiss his BROTHER -- an adolescent dressed in the novice-robe, with a solemn, delicate face.  DIEGO'S response is constrained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diego!  Aren't you going to kiss your brother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIEGO smiles a little, and kisses FERNANDO -- who is immediately distracted by a procession of hooded MONKS, hurrying to the refectory, as a bell begins to chime. The MONKS all turn to greet ANTONIO DE MARCHENA, a white- haired, elderly man -- and a monk cosmographer. MARCHENA'S gesture is broad and elegant as he opens his arms to greet COLUMBUS.  He pats FERNANDO'S head and turn to DIEGO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diego, take Fernando to the dining hall.  He must be hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both CHILDREN leave under the arched roof.  COLUMBUS and MARCHENA begin to walk across the cloister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diego is a bright boy -- a pleasure to teach -- but so serious... Brothers should be raised together, Colon.  Even brothers from different mothers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father, I am doing what I think is the best for him.  And he has the teacher I would have chosen for myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCHENA laughs at the compliment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just be careful you don't lose him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have crossed the cloister.  MARCHENA pushes open a door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hundreds of books lined up on the shelves, displaying the miracle of printing, a recent German discovery.  Several MONKS, perched on high stools behind lecterns, are busily "ILLUMINATING" some of these massive volumes, delicately painting around the letters in bright colors and gold leaf. Rays of light fall diagonally through high openings, projecting geometric patterns on the tiled floor.  As MARCHENA and COLUMBUS move forward their conversation is punctuated by light and shadow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fumbles in a pocket under his robe) I have something for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost casually, he hands COLUMBUS a letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will be heard at the University of Salamanca...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS stops dead in his tracks.  Almost frantically he tears open the letter, hardly able to believe his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God... That's in a week!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what it says.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you manage it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) With some difficulty.  I had to promise them you were not a total fool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCHENA pushes open a second door, hidden behind a woode panel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCHENA is not a tidy man.  Books are piled up on the floor, the desk, on every shelf, along with maps, instruments of astronomy... the visible evidence of an inquiring mind. With practiced familiarity, as if they had done this a hundred times -- which indeed they have -- MARCHENA sits behind his desk, and COLUMBUS opposite him.  MARCHENA lights a candle and considers the mess.  Then methodically, he slowly sweeps it from in front of him with his sleeve, exposing a large map underneath. When he looks up again, there is a new severity in his expression.  He turns over an hourglass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you wish to sail west?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To open a new route to Asia.  At the moment there are only two ways of reaching it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans forward, and points to the map spread out on the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By sea, sailing around the African Continent -- the journey takes a year...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His finger traces the journey, from west to east.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or by land...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are CLOSE now on the map, as we watch his finger tracing a line between Europe and the Far East.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... But the Turks have closed this route to all Christians.  Trading with the Orient has become arduous, if not dangerous. (he pauses) There is a third way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We notice that the outline of the European continent is familiar.  But we also notice that, in that great expanse of ocean, the whole American continent is missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By sailing West across the Ocean Sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON MARCHENA'S FACE, touched by the mystery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you be so certain?  The Ocean is said to be infinite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ignorance!  I believe the Indies are no more than 750 leagues west of the Canary Islands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you be so certain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The calculations of Toscanelli Marin de Tyr, Esdras...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Esdras is a Jew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So was Christ!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCHENA throws his quill in the air in frustration.  He glances at the hourglass:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two minutes... and already you're a dead man.  Don't let passion overwhelm you, Colon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mockingly) I'll try to remember that, Marchena...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father Marchena!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring this) Passion is something one cannot control!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heatedly) You get so carried away when you are being contradicted!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been contradicted all my life... Eternity!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amused) Only God knows the meaning of such words, my son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIEGO and FERNANDO wait in the courtyard.  COLUMBUS appears and lifts FERNANDO onto the mule.  DIEGO turns to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diego.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS walks over to him, squats down so their eyes meet.  He looks at his SON for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like to come and stay with us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncomfortable with the proposition, DIEGO cannot find an answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do whatever makes you happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am happy, Father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS reaches out -- and touches his shoulder. He climbs up behind FERNANDO, who waves back to his BROTHER as they ride off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS leads the mule, carrying the sleeping FERNANDO, through narrow streets.  There's a clamorous noise in the air.  Suddenly a large group of YOUNG MEN, shouting with excitement, run up the street and brush past them.  Then more people.  FERNANDO sits up straight.  The noise grows rowdy, rumbling, sharp with excitement and violence. Huge CROWDS have thronged the massive old square outside the cathedral.  Holding the mule by its reins, COLUMBUS tries to push his way through... Suddenly, as a gap opens in the crowd, we see the cause of the excitement:  in the center of the square stand three pyres, already alit. HOODED EXECUTIONERS are busy around the fires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Father!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before COLUMBUS can stop him, FERNANDO has slipped off th mule and into the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fernando!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the BOY has been swallowed into the mass of people. COLUMBUS tries to follow him.  Flames leap into the night sky with a terrible crackling, lighting up the square wit a lurid glow.  Prayers are being chanted somewhere. FERNANDO has elbowed his way to the front of the crowd. A PRIEST brandishes a crucifix in front of the face of a MAN bound to a post.  The heretic wears the "sambenito", robe made of coarse fabric on which his sins have been crudely illustrated -- we see cabalistic signs, indicating that the man is Jewish. THE MAN'S eyes are mad with fear.  But he refuses to kiss the crucifix, as a sign of his repentance. FERNANDO is transfixed by the scene, but still doesn't realize what is happening.  He is too close to the platform to see what is in the flames of the other pyres.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fernando!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He motions to his son, takes the BOY'S hand, and drags hi away from the scene.  But FERNANDO looks back.  The distance now allows him to see inside the flames. A HALF-CHARRED FIGURE -- THE MAN'S face is distorted in a silent scream... The neck snaps like burning wood, and th head falls on one shoulder.  Then the whole body collapse into the fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS and FERNANDO lead the mule into the white-washed stone-floored hallway of the modest house.  FERNANDO is mute, shocked by what he just witnessed.  COLUMBUS takes the mule into its stall, and as he does so, his mother, BEATRIX, appears from the kitchen to greet them.  She is beautiful woman in her twenties, a calm, strong, domestic personality.  COLUMBUS tousles the BOY'S hair.  FERNANDO glances at his MOTHER but looks subdued and doesn't say anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS joins BEATRIX in the kitchen, where a MAID is cooking.  He explains Fernando's subdued manner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Executions.  In the square.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEATRIX nods.  He goes to the stone butt and pours water on his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've agreed to see me in a week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEATRIX puts the candle on the table.  Her face lights up with a smile.  He walks to her, and kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could be gone for years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't given you much of a life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amused) Well... that's true.  I have a child by a man who won't marry me!  Who's always leaving...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we going to argue?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd love to argue with you sometimes.  But you're never here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They laugh and kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps I was never meant to live with a woman...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still kissing him) I find that hard to believe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are eating around the table, and FERNANDO is unusually silent and thoughtful.  COLUMBUS pours a little wine into FERNANDO'S water, to distract him.  FERNANDO looks up at him, surprised.  COLUMBUS smiles, then looks over at BEATRIX.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fernando, don't you think we are lucky to live with such a beautiful woman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He winks at FERNANDO.  BEATRIX smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is dark.  As COLUMBUS approached the bed with a candle, it illuminates the naked body of BEATRIX.  BEATRI looks up at him intently.  A drop of wax falls on her skin.  She flinches, murmurs... They make love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A medieval "campus".  Students-novices are playing "pelote", with basket-gloves and a hard ball.  They run with their robes tucked around their waist, revealing white legs.  Others are studying, reading, hurrying to their class. We find COLUMBUS watching the game from the steps above the court.  Others are waiting with him.  A MONK comes from a door, and looks around the group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitant) Christopher Columbus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An El Greco painting.  A tableau of twenty MEN sitting on dark, sculpted seats.  Candles throw a gloomy light on their faces.  Some are Churchmen, others are dressed in bourgeois outfits. Only one of them is richly dressed in the grand Spanish fashion -- he is SANCHEZ, Treasurer of the House of Aragon.  A MONK (Don AROJAZ) holds a stick with an ivory claw at the top.  Languidly, he scratches his back -- his off-hand manner only makes him more impressive than his peers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You say Asia can be found by sailing west?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, your Eminence.  The voyage should not take more than six or seven weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unfortunately, Don Colon, that is precisely where our opinions differ... (pause) Are you familiar with the work of Aristotle?  Erathostene?  Ptolemeus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am, Your Eminence

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you cannot ignore that according to their calculations, the circumference of the Earth is approximately... (he leans forward) 22,000 leagues or more.  Which makes the ocean... uncrossable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans back, satisfied, and pauses for effect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you may have found new evidence proving that these men of knowledge are totally mistaken!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ripple of mirthless laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Excellencies are aware of the statements of Marin de Tyr?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you are also aware that his theories contradict Ptolemeus... De Tyr believes the Ocean to be only 750 leagues...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A murmur of protest spreads among the members of the Commission.  But Columbus is determined to press his theories.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Florentine Toscanelli and the French Cardinal Pierre d'Ailly both think that Marin de Tyr is accurate in his calculations.  And therefore, that the ocean can be crossed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indignant and amused murmurs.  DIEGO DE DEZA raises his voice to quiet the assembly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, let us suppose Marin de Tyr is right... (the laughter subsides) Are we here to examine this proposal or not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Columbus) In your opinion, how long would the voyage be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven weeks.  Six, during the summer months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The murmur increases.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marin de Tyr is wrong -- and has been corrected many times over the centuries by the finest geographers. Your voyage, Don Colon, would take a year!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAN of simple bearing, that COLUMBUS identifies as being a seaman, interrupts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How would the crew survive without being able to land for fresh water? Water is undrinkable after six weeks!  You'd never be able to turn back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We wouldn't have to turn back!  We would find land at this point!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Senor Colon, an experienced captain such as yourself will understand our concern with the crew.  I am not willing to have on my conscience the loss of men who would have relied upon our judgment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellency, you are right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instantly, the protests stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am a seaman, not a scholar... But as a simple man craving for knowledge, I have read all the work of these renowned geographers and discovered that none of them could agree on the exact width of this ocean...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pauses, and starts walking in front of the experts, as a lawyer before a grand jury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Therefore, as a modest man, I wonder:  who is right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The experts listen.  CLOSE ON SANCHEZ'S FACE, impressed b the boldness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is right?  This question remains unanswered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks and stops before TALAVERA, and catches the look of SANCHEZ, sitting just behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Eminence, there is only one way to settle the matter.  And that is to make the journey. (to the assembly, with passion) I am ready to risk my life to prove it possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your life, and that of others!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If they agree to follow me, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suppose you cross this ocean. Suppose you reach Asia.  What would Spain do there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conscious of a friendlier voice, COLUMBUS sees the Treasurer SANCHEZ, an imposing man in his fifties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trade, Your Excellency.  According to Marco Polo, the Kingdom of China is one of the richest of the world. Even the meanest buildings are roofed with gold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Is that all that interests you? Gold?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  The Portuguese have already discovered black-skinned people.  I, too, will find other populations -- and bring them to the word of God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE MONK smiles thinly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christopher -- Christo Ferens -- the Bearer of the Cross!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ironic) And Colon -- the one who populates!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another small rill of laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If God intended our proximity to Asia, do you believe he would have waited for you to show it to the world?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did He not choose a carpenter's son to reveal Himself to the world?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hum of interest.  CLOSE ON SANCHEZ -- watching COLUMBUS intently, a hint of an admiring smile on his lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you consider yourself the chosen one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you realize your words could be considered heretical?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calmly) Blind faith is what I consider heresy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The murmur turns to an audible gasp.  AROJAZ gets to his feet and leans forward, threateningly, the flame of a candle only inches from his face. There is absolute silence.  COLUMBUS meets the MONK'S gaz unflinchingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Asia can be found to the west -- and I will prove it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IF-GOD-WILLS-IT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The JURY is alone to deliberate.  Food and wine has been laid out on tables.  In the distance, students' cries carry over the conversation. SANCHEZ approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Treasurer of Spain honors us with his presence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SANCHEZ bows slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The State has some reason to be interested in this man's proposition, Your Eminence...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Judgment is ours!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naturally.  But I would really deplore the loss of such a potential opportunity for Spain for a... dispute over a point of geography.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SANCHEZ helps himself to some grapes, looks round at the other members of the committee, who pretend not to be listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) He is a mercenary!  Did he not already try to convince the King of Portugal of his absurd notions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indeed.  The world is full of mercenaries -- and states often make use of them, when it benefits them. (casually) My only concern is the welfare and prosperity of Spain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AROJAZ understands the hint, and stops smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You would use your influence to assist this... intriguer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SANCHEZ reaches for a decanter of sherry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Your Eminence, the fascinating thing about power, is that what can be given so effortlessly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He offers the decanter to AROJAZ, who automatically lifts his glass.  But instead, SANCHEZ pulls back the decanter, pours himself a drink, and replaces it on the table, leaving AROJAZ staring at his own empty glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... can so easily be taken away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he drinks with a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCHENA reads aloud the Commission's letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and therefore nothing could justify the participation of Your Highnesses in the venture that relies upon such feeble assumptions, and which any man of knowledge would take to be impractical... if not impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shakes his head, puts the letter down.  COLUMBUS looks appalled; devastated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They didn't listen.  They didn't want to listen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He paces about the book-lined room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mustn't give way to despair. You must wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!  I've waited seven years already!  How much longer do you want me to wait?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If God intends you to go, then you will go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angrily) Damn God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCHENA is shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn all of you!  You all set up theories based on what?  You never leave the safety of your studies! Go out!  Find out what the world is about and then tell me something I can listen to!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He seizes a beautiful book from MARCHENA'S desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These don't mean anything!  They're full of assumptions!  Out of the heads of old men who've never been past the end of their gardens!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hurls the book across the room.  MARCHENA is horrified

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...!  My books...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS seizes more books from the shelves, just sweepin them to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of them!  Just lies!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colon!  Don't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCHENA tries to stop him.  In his fury, COLUMBUS accidentally knocks the poor old MAN to the ground.  His cries bring three MONKS rushing into the room. As COLUMBUS continues to rage and scatter books everywhere, they try to stop him, struggling with this big, powerful man -- to almost comical effect.  Finally, short, muscular MONK delivers a quick punch that sends COLUMBUS crashing to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS lies face down on the stone floor.  He is dresse in a homespun robe.  His arms are stretched out in penance.  FERNANDO and DIEGO look down at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sssshhhh...!  One can't speak to a man doing penance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.  That's the point, Fernando.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause -- and then FERNANDO lies face down on the floor beside his FATHER, and stretches out his arms in the same way.  DIEGO is left looking on, unable to bring himself t join them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Along the cloister, maps are drying, hanging like laundry in the light breeze.  COLUMBUS pins up a new addition. Another MONK works nearby, in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Senor Colon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS turns, to see a small, stocky MAN approaching: middle-class gentleman.  He nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, thank God!  I've been looking all over Seville for you!  Never expected to find a sailor in a monastery, eh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He laughs.  COLUMBUS smiles, but doesn't say anything. PINZON is clearly a little surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name's Pinzon, by the way.  Martin Alonzo Pinzon.  I'm a ship owner from Palos...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS glances around cautiously, and walks a little wa down the cloister, away from the other MONK, gesturing fo PINZON to follow him.  PINZON is yet more surprised by this strange behavior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating the monk) Is he a spy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS shakes his head.  PINZON stares at him, perplexed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?  Are you a Trappist?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS shakes his head again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vow of silence...?  Penance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS nods vigorously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus!  Just my luck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes off his hat, wiping his forehead with a silk cloth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen.  I'll do the talking for both of us.  You just nod.  Agreed? Just as I do with the wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that the Commission turned you down, right?  What do you expect?  You're a foreigner... But I want to help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS gives him a glance like one throws a question in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wonder why I believe in you? Hey, I am a seaman.  And we don't like to be told where to go, and where not to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS looks at him, and bursts out laughing.  The othe MONK looks round severely.  COLUMBUS ducks behind a map, PINZON following him.  PINZON lowers his voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't look like it, but I have friends at the Court.  The Treasurer of Aragon, for example.  He finances me.  His name's Santangel.  Ever heard of him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS shakes his head, but looks increasingly interested by what he's hearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can get you an audience with the Queen!  You know why...?  She owes him money.  That's how it is.  You -- me -- the Queen -- the world and his mistress -- agreed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So.  What do you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS looks around, catches the disapproving face of the MONK, crosses himself, then speaks:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where can I meet this man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating with a nod) Immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS turns and sees an elegant Lord in his fifties, examining the maps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge Islamic Crescent being pulled down from the minare of a mosque.  SOLDIERS are holding back a crowd at the foot of the tower.  To the ecstatic cries of the crowd, a Cross is hoisted up in its place... Astride horses, COLUMBUS and the Treasurer SANTANGEL are watching the scene. They push through an extraordinary scene.  The city of Granada has just been reclaimed from the moors after several years of siege.  All around them, SPANISH SOLDIER are herding, bedraggled columns of the defeated MOORS, bearing only a few possessions.  Ragged, half-starved men women and children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These people built Granada... Centuries ago!  It is a great victory over the Moors, Don Colon -- and yet what a tragedy it is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The THREE HORSEMEN pass a procession of grateful PENITENTS, who are crawling on their knees, chanting psalms and flagellating themselves.  At the head of the procession, HOODED PRIESTS carry a statue of the Virgin Mary swathed in silk and lace. The gates of the Alhambra Palace are in sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this a good time to meet her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It couldn't be better.  Victors can't say no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bells are pealing triumphantly.  The noise is tumultuous. They ride towards the magnificent palace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fabulous Moorish gardens:  ponds filled with golden carp; exotic bird cages hang from lemon trees... The distant sounds of victory. SANTANGEL and COLUMBUS walk through the gardens, escorted by HALBERDIERS.  SOLDIERS pass by, carrying coffers or piles of documents. As they approach the inner sanctum, however, there are fewer people.  They stop by the Lion's Fountain, where several DIGNITARIES are waiting patiently for an audience SANCHEZ appears.  They bow.  SANTANGEL approaches to murmur a compliment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Excellency... truly grateful... your help... as ever...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SANCHEZ protests softly, and looks over at COLUMBUS, a half-smile forming on his lips.  Then a DUENA appears, an motions for COLUMBUS to follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ornate Moorish door is pushed open by the DUENA'S hand We enter the Throne Room -- sculptured colonnades, mosaics... At the far end, windows open onto a view of Granada's rooftops. Against this dazzling light, the delicate silhouette of QUEEN ISABEL OF SPAIN.  The light in her blonde hair creates a halo around her head as she turns.  COLUMBUS falls to his knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rise...!  Come forward!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He approaches the window, stopping close to her.  ISABEL scrutinizes him quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should not even be listening to you, since my council said no.  But Santangel tells me you are a man of honor and sincerity... And Sanchez, that you are not a fool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bold) No more than the woman who said she would take Granada from the Moors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ISABEL smiles, enjoying the lack of obsequiousness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ocean is uncrossable?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did they say about Granada before today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat) That she was impregnable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ISABEL smiles again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I cannot ignore the verdict of my council.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surely you can do anything you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A direct challenge.  She doesn't know what to make of thi man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How little you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This little hint of vulnerability subtly reverses their positions for a moment.  Now we sense COLUMBUS scrutinizing her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I speak freely?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a smile) You show no inclination to speak otherwise!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what I see.  I see someone who doesn't accept the world as it is.  Who's not afraid.  I see a women who thinks... "What if?"...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amused at his familiarity) A woman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A slight pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgive me... but you're the only Queen I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She bursts out laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we are equal... since you are the only sailor I know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How old are you, Senor Colon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty seven, Your Majesty... And you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once again taken off guard, ISABEL flushes, and turns awa slightly to hide it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty eight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will be informed of our decision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS bows and goes to leave.  As the DUENA opens the door for him, he turns back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I thought you were younger than me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he goes out, leaving her stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A chalk white road, lined with trees.  Two liveried SERVANTS are walking down the road, one carrying a large silver tray, the other a smaller tray. They are overtaken by an ADMINISTRATOR who hurries along the road, with documents under his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CLERK enters an imposing stable block. In the paddock, SANCHEZ is training a magnificent young horse, making it step sideways, bending it to his will. The ADMINISTRATOR watches him, unable to interrupt. Behind him the two SERVANTS can be seen bringing in the silver trays, with covered dishes of food, a decanter of wine.  They begin to lay them out on a table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SANCHEZ pours himself some wine, tucks into his his food, while the ADMINISTRATOR, clearly working himself up into frenzy, reads from a document.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and he demands... he DEMANDS to be made a Knight, with the right to bear the Golden Spurs!  He will receive the title of Don Cristobal Colon -- which will be extended to his descendants for ever more...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ADMINISTRATOR looks up.  He is reading the contract that COLUMBUS has proposed.  SANCHEZ, his mouth full, gestures for him to continue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He will be named Great Admiral of the Ocean Sea.  Viceroy of the West Indies... Governor of all islands or lands discovered or as will be discovered with his help...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ADMINISTRATOR looks up again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The highest titles of nobility, Your Excellency!  To an immigrant sheltered by monks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SANCHEZ gestures for the document.  Wipes his mouth. Continues reading, calmly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Furthermore he will receive one eight of all wealth or monies, precious gems, pearls, metals, spices and other lucrative sources conquered within the boundaries of his admiralty...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles, hands the document back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's very underdone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exploding) Underdone!  It's monstrous, Excellency!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, the pheasant.  It's almost raw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he carries on eating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You worry too much, Carvajal... The man will have to lower his demands. Believe me, he WILL!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close up on COLUMBUS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I WON'T!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WOMAN'S HAND quietly, carefully opens a cover of a spy hole in the wall.  Two beautiful eyes peer through a grille, into the next room. What they see: SANCHEZ and COLUMBUS together.  COLUMBUS is visibly upset

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calmly) We have considered your -- demands very carefully, Senor Colon... Your expectations are... excessive, in every way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS tightens his fists, tries to remain calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I am right, my requests are fair!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SANCHEZ holds up a document.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have prepared our own contract...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He offers the document to COLUMBUS, who takes it, scans i quickly, shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO...!  I have waited too long, fought too hard.  Now you expect me to take all the risks while you take the profit!  No... I will not be your servant!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The eyes behind the screen -- the mouth, forming a little smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remind you, Senor Colon, that you are in no position to bargain with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not bargaining!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (steely) Then you are too ambitious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS leans over the table, faces him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And were you never ambitious, Excellency?  Or is ambition only a virtue among the nobles, a fault for the rest of us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (abrupt) If you won't accept our proposal, we'll simply find someone who will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you can do that, Excellency -- I'll become a monk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns, strides towards the door.  We hear a WOMAN'S muffled laughter. As COLUMBUS goes out, ISABEL appears through a secret door.  SANCHEZ bows. ISABEL goes over to the window and looks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were right, Don Sanchez... His demands could never be granted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never, Your Majesty.  Although...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns, questioningly, towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Although one may always renegotiate a contract.  Especially signed by Royal Hands.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: SANCHEZ joins ISABEL at the window.  They see COLUMBUS striding out and away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) ... Into a monk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a smile) Yes.  It would be a pity, wouldn't it? (turning to Sanchez) Call him back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Teeming life.  COLUMBUS pushing his way through crowds. He is expressionless and distracted. He looks around him, stops walking.  And then, unexpectedly, shouts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YEEEEEEES!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All heads turn as if he were totally insane.  He walks on as if nothing happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS is sitting at the kitchen table, by himself, wit a glass of wine.  There is a movement behind him.  BEATRI is standing at the foot of the stairs, in a night-shirt. COLUMBUS turns and looks at her, almost sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moved) Thank God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles.  But he seems to be unable to share her happiness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I ever come back, I swear I will...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She crosses to him quickly, placing her hand gently on hi mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) I'm not asking you to swear to anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want you to wait for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) That's something you can't decide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strange, unearthly music... A flickering light in a dark tunnel.  FERNANDO, holding a candle in front of him, walk slowly down the dark corridor. Quietly opening a door, he walks into COLUMBUS' study.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON:  A huge illustrated map of western Europe and Asia.  FERNANDO'S candle moves slowly across the Atlantic Ocean, to the edge of the map.  There, the illustrator's imagination has created monsters:  terrifying demons; creatures half-human, half-animal. Sitting at his desk, COLUMBUS is looking at the map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't go there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turning, COLUMBUS finds his son beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FERNANDO points at the monsters.  He pulls the boy to him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There aren't any monsters, Fernando. The only monsters are in here... (he taps his own forehead) Watch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a pen, and draws a smile on one of the terrible monsters, transforming it at once.  FERNANDO laughs immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to go with you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There'll be a time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You promise? (Columbus nods his head) Do you swear on St. Christopher...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FERNANDO pulls the chain with the St. Christopher medal from under COLUMBUS' shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you swear on all the Holy Saints in heaven?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) Yes... Yes, I do... On all of them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he hugs his SON tightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A luminous procession passes through a Moorish stone gate down to the harbor.  We see the faces of the SAILORS and their FAMILIES -- COLUMBUS, PINZON AMONGST THEM -- We sense the fervor and apprehension of the departure.  The procession is lead by MARCHENA and four young NOVICES carrying the Madonna.  All hold long, burning tapers, saying the rosary.  A SAILOR pushes through the crowd, an kisses the Madonna's feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hundreds of candles flicker in the pre-dawn light, held b the FAMILIES and FRIENDS of the SAILORS. The SANTA MARIA the PINTA and the NINA nestle against the quayside.  Dwarfed by the hulls, a flotilla of smaller fishing craft, returning from night fishing, accidentally witness this event.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCHENA sits on a barrel and crosses himself.  Behind a curtain sits COLUMBUS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Nomine Patris et Filius, et Spiritus Sancti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgive me, Father.  For I have sinned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCHENA recognizes COLUMBUS' voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am listening, my son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father, I have betrayed my family. I betrayed my men.  And I betrayed you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I lied.  The journey will be longer than I said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not sure... It could be twice the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May God forgive you...!  You must tell them!  You must tell your men!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I tell them, they won't follow me.  You know that I am right, Father.  You trust me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My son, my son... (he shakes his head) Your certitudes are sometimes frightening... (pause) Christopher, you must speak to them. And if you don't I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are bound by an oath, Father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believed in you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me absolution.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me absolution, Father!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Devastated, MARCHENA reluctantly makes the sign of the cross.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS walks over to where BEATRIX and FERNANDO are waiting.  He kisses and hugs FERNANDO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ispo Te Absoluto.  May God forgive you and have mercy on your soul, Christopher Columbus.  Go in peace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CROWDED QUAYSIDE.  COLUMBUS stands in front of FERNANDO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be good to your mother, Fernando. Do you promise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FERNANDO nods, tears in his eyes.  Then COLUMBUS embraces BEATRIX tightly.  She whispers into his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speak to Diego.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But COLUMBUS and DIEGO are unable to find words, and instead they clumsily hug.  Someone taps COLUMBUS' shoulder.  He turns around to see SANTANGEL.  Wordlessly, they hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Activity on the ships, orders are being shouted, ropes fore and aft are cast off, splashing into the water... No the SHIPS are slowly moving parallel to the quayside.  Th CROWD starts walking abreast to the VESSELS.  WOMEN holding up babies, blowing kisses, old PARENTS crying... BEATRIX, HER SONS, AND SANTANGEL are among them. COLUMBUS suddenly unties the chain around his neck, and throws it at DIEGO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diego!  Here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIEGO catches it.  Opening his hand he looks at the medallion.  Then looks up at his FATHER, elated. THE SANTA MARIA is now two meters from the QUAY. SANTANGEL is now opposite COLUMBUS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (casually) Take care of my investment, wherever you're going!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ambiguous) I have to tell you Santangel.  I don't know where on earth I am going!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both laugh. A FISHERMAN, standing in his shrimp-boat lets his hand slide gently along the gigantic hull.  He stares up at th SAILORS leaning on the rail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vaya con Dios!  (Go with God!)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They wave back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCHENA walking towards the Moorish gate.  He finally turns, sad and distraught.  He sees:

dialogues.speaker: THREE SHIPS ON A BOUNDLESS OCEAN.
dialogues.text: The sea resembling a DORMANT MONSTER, holding its breath. A living being, all powerful, capable of unpredictable metamorphosis.  Music reflects the loneliness, the anxiet of the crew, the fear of the unknown... ENORMOUS WHALES moving slowly alongside, surging majestically through the waves.  Sinking back, disappearing, their cries taking precedent over the music

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SHIP'S BOY is throwing buckets of water on the deck. A SAILOR is busy clearing the ropes around the mast. A COOK is blowing life into a brazier, in preparation of the evening meal. TEN MEN heaving on a heavy rope, raising the top sail, punctuating their efforts with a sailor's chant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crystalline north star -- as if seen through an instrument. COLUMBUS' silhouette, by an oil lamp, standing at the prow.  Holding a quadrant he is aiming at the stars. SOME SAILORS are watching with curiosity.  One of them is ALONSO, a rough, stocky Basque. Near COLUMBUS, on a tressel, various books and charts.  H makes an entry in the log.  Then goes back to his quadrant.  He senses MENDEZ standing next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Due west, Captain Mendez.  And may God be with us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God be with us admiral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MENDEZ doesn't move, continuing to observe COLUMBUS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it Mendez?  Speak!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MENDEZ is hesitant.  He nervously clears his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... It's the men, Sir.  They wonder how you know our position. We've lost sight from land days ago...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still taking readings) And what do you think Mendez?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I surely know what a quadrant is!  But I've never seen it used at night before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MENDEZ hesitates, then motions to COLUMBUS.  The SAILORS are watching, and some approach to hear the conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, find the North Star.  Do you have it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The picture swims across the heavens, until we see the north star.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steady yourself...!  Keep the plumb line vertical...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The picture steadies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MENDEZ nods -- and loses equilibrium.  The plumb line swings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move!  A mistake of one degree and we'll be off 6,000 leagues!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MENDEZ tries again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you read?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty eight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MENDEZ turns to COLUMBUS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it.  The twenty eighth parallel.  And we'll follow it until we reach land.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALONSO does not seem convinced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know land is on the twenty eighth parallel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blazing sun.  The ship is like a furnace, its brass fittings too hot to touch, the blistering heat making the air shimmer over the decks. Desperate for shade, sailors are sheltering under the sagging prow sail. The SHIP'S BOY throws an empty bucket attached to a rope over the side and hauls it back up again, brimming with water.  As he turns, we see his face, disfigured by a hai lip.  He drenches himself... From the shade, ALONSO watches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chicken-ass face!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others laugh.  The BOY, ashamed, tries to ignore them ALONSO'S hand accidentally touches a brass fitting; he reacts like he was burnt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sucks his blistered fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never seen heat like this!  Not even in Las Minas!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The water's going putrid in the barrels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be drinking your own piss... For the glory of Spain... and Admiral Colon...!  Bastard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SHIP'S BOY glances round at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you listening to, chicken ass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, leave him alone.  He's doing no harm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a face like that? (to boy) I don't want you looking at me.  You hear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BOY turns away, dropping the bucket back into the sea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's the devil's child...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll all go crazy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BOY throws more water over the deck.  A SAILOR takes his guitar, and starts singing an improvised song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Culo de galina es el hijo del demonio... (Chicken ass mouth is the devil's child... Born from the loins of a stinky old goat etc...)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all laugh.  The BOY, hearing this, climbs to the crow's-nest like a monkey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We experience a sense of vertigo as we near the top of th main mast, high above the rolling deck. The BOY curls like a fetus in the swinging crow's-nest, exhausted by the heat, and scared.  His eyes are turning white.  He begins to piss himself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piss is dripping on the deck.  THE SAILORS do not seem to care.  THE COOK takes a chicken from a cage.  He breaks its neck, and starts plucking it.  The OTHERS continue their bitter conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should have seen land.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We left three weeks ago, Alonso. Can't be that near.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't be that far, I say.  Also, I don't like the smell of the sea around here.  Smells like a cunt. Bad sign...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The COOK starts laughing.  They turn to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) Of course it smells like it!  That's why sailors take to the sea!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all laugh.  Alonso looks up at COLUMBUS standing on the poop deck, scrutinizing the horizon, waiting for the land to appear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And why does this one take to the sea?  Nobody knows.  Never says a word...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MENDEZ has sensed the danger of this lack of respect.  He approaches them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To your post!  At once!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They split in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SHIP is plowing on, pushed by a hot wind -- SAILORS sleep on deck. The SHIP'S BOY is singing to himself.  Despite his hair lip he has a pure, melancholy voice... COLUMBUS, leaning over the prow rail, staring ahead, hear it carry over the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE UP ON AN HOUR-GLASS, nearly through its time. The SHIP'S BOY throws an "ampoulette" over board.  We follow the bulb attached to a rope, passing the full length of the hull.  As it reaches the poop deck, another SAILOR shouts "MARK".  A very primitive system of calculation for distance and speed. Sitting near the SHIP'S BOY, COLUMBUS is making entries i a log-book, watching the hourglass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark.  Twenty nine, Sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE HOUR-GLASS runs out.  COLUMBUS converts the mark into a daily average for distance and speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six hundred and twenty nine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE SHIP'S BOY cups his hands to his mouth to shout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINZON, his OFFICERS beside him, looks across at the SANT MARIA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six hundred and twenty nine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AN OFFICER turns to PINZON to repeat the message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six hundred and twenty nine, Sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINZON does not seem too pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE OFFICER examines his own calculations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes back to his cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABSOLUTE STILLNESS.  A FURNACE.  The three ships like dots, on what seems to be a prairie of weed. The caravels are being towed by three rowing boats. CLOSE ON THE MEN, rowing, drenched with sweat. FROM THE PROW, COLUMBUS is staring at the horizon. ALONSO pulling at his oars stares at COLUMBUS' distant figure with hate and resentment. ALONSO suddenly ships his oars, throwing the whole boat into disarray.  Chaos. Total silence.  MENDEZ and ALONSO stare at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Continue rowing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALONSO defiantly stares at MENDEZ.  He then starts to bea a rhythm on the hull with his fist, followed by the others.  In the two other boats, the MEN begin to follow suit, beating a rhythm of protest on the hulls. MENDEZ looks up to COLUMBUS, in panic. ON BOARD PINZON'S SHIP, an OFFICER cups his hands to his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Pinzon requests permission to board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Granted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINZON enters.  He looks furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lied!  You cheated!  We're way past 750 leagues!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calmly) Six days ago, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be mad...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to keep the hopes of these men alive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're on the verge of a mutiny, Colon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I don't know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're lost!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The land is there.  I know it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know anything!  Listen Colon, these are my ships, right? So I'm telling you we're turning back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then what?  Half of the water has gone, the rest is nearly putrid! You know that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (apoplectic) Jesus Maria!  I should have never listened to you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never did.  You did all the talking for both of us, remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bloody...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinzon, Pinzon... All we can do now is go forward!  Think about that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell that to them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right.  Let the men decide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS moves to the door.  As an afterthought, he takes his scarlet-embroidered jacket from a hook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most of the men are now back on board. They go silent as COLUMBUS appears.  He walks slowly over to them.  All, including ALONSO, are surly, threatening..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who gave you the order to come on board?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up and down the line, finishing on ALONSO.  They stare at one another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God doesn't want us to cross the ocean...!  This voyage is cursed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of the MEN murmur their agreement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cursed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We set sail for greed.  God has abandoned us.  The voyage is cursed. There are signs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALONSO glances towards the SHIP'S BOY, with his hair lip. The BOY lowers his eyes.  COLUMBUS moves towards him, pulls him forward, stands him in front of ALONSO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This boy has the voice of an angel. What comes out of his mouth is blessed, Alonso.  What comes out of your is evil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of the men laugh at this statement.  ALONSO is ill a ease.  COLUMBUS pauses, looks around at all the MEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me!  Every man is afraid who does something for the first time.  But those who overcome their fears, will find their rewards.  I do not know if it is God's will that we cross this ocean -- but I am certain it is the devil who puts fears into our hearts...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MEN are listening.  We sense a subtle change of mood...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This jacket to the first man who sights land!  I want a man up that mast day and night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS points at the SHIP'S BOY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You start first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SHIP'S BOY rushes up the mast.  As he climbs, the mainsail starts to fill with wind.  The deck begins to move under their feet. This movement under their feet seems to imperceptibly erase the fears and the angers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alonso!  Jaime!  Don't let this wind escape us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRIES from the other ships, as the sails snap taut, filling with wind.  MEN rush to their posts.  PINZON stares at COLUMBUS, shaking his head in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (murmuring) You lucky bastard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS walks away to his cabin, then turning back to PINZON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinzon, the more I sail, the luckier I get.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turning abruptly, he enters his cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS is seated, isolated at the prow, wrapped in his cape, struggling against the sleep.  MENDEZ approaches hi with a bowl of soup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall I take my turn?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS shakes his head no, and starts drinking from the bowl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS' head nods lower and lower to his chest.  He is asleep.  We become aware of a sharp buzzing sound.  It becomes louder as we move closer to COLUMBUS' face. A mosquito lands on his temple.  COLUMBUS reflexively slaps it.  He wakes up, and looks at his fingers -- a spo of blood, a crushed mosquito.  He stares at it for a moment.  Then slowly gets to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the luminous moonlight, COLUMBUS is standing, staring up at thousands of insects that wheel around the mast lantern.  We hear the flutter of their wings and see the bats as they swoop and dive in a feeding frenzy. COLUMBUS turns, stares into the darkness, desperate to se the land that must be close. He kneels by MENDEZ, wrapped in a blanket.  He touches hi shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (murmuring) Mendez!  Mendez!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MENDEZ grimaces, and opens one eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Land...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An opaque dawn.  COLUMBUS, riveted, staring forward as if to pierce the mist.  The entire crew are clinging to the rail, and standing on the shrouds. Suddenly, the SHIP BOY'S voice cracking with emotion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIERRA...!  TIERRA!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS strains his eyes; he still can not see anything. The entire CREW stand and stare, silent, holding their breath. As the sun begins to rise, the fog dissipates -- slowly, exquisitely, revealing a single palm, so close it seems almost as though they could touch it.  Then a white slash of beach. Near COLUMBUS, a SAILOR falls to his knees and burst into tears.  Others laugh with joy.  COLUMBUS watches this vision in disbelief, his mouth open as if it were difficult for him to breathe.  Tears come to his eyes.  H closes them.  Then opens them again.  The land is there - a green paradise. On screen the words:  OCTOBER 12, 1942.  GUANAHAN ISLAND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three row boats plunging through the surf towards the beach.  COLUMBUS stands in the prow of the first boat. MENDEZ is in the second.  PINZON the third.  They stare entranced at the lushness of the foliage, and the blue clarity of the water... As the first boat beaches, COLUMBUS leaps out and wades ashore.  Behind him the rest of the landing party splash through the sun-dazzled water, carrying the banner of Castille and Aragon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stand on the beach, almost in a dream.  There is silence.  The ROYAL NOTARY, ludicrously overdressed, now wet through, stumbles over to COLUMBUS and holds out his contract and a pen.  COLUMBUS scrawls his name. The MEN stare at him, filled not only with new respect, but with something amounting to awe. COLUMBUS turns to them, tries to speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the... by the Grace of... God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He swallows.  Tears have sprung to his eyes.  He is so moved he cannot continue.  Coming to his rescue -- THE SHIP'S BOY starts to roll the drum.  He then stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling himself together) In the name of their Gracious Majesties of Castille and Aragon, and by all the powers vested in me, I claim this island and name it San Salvador.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MEN cheer as the flags are rammed into the sand, flapping in the wind. COLUMBUS starts to walk towards the jungle, and in silenc the rest follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Immediately they are met by an incredible wall of SOUND! The jungle is filled with NOISE.  The impossibly-loud CRIES of EXOTIC BIRDS, the CHATTERING of MONKEYS.  The SPANIARDS are overwhelmed. They move forward.  Rays of sunlight pierce through the high canopy of leaves, like the roof of a magnificent cathedral.  The sounds and smells intoxicate their senses They are filled with wonder. Then PINZON stops.  He has seen something.  Another stops then a third, staring ahead of them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering urgently) Arquebuses!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several of them raise their weapons to their shoulders, pointing them into the jungle. From COLUMBUS' POV we slowly scan the face of the thick jungle ahead.  For a moment we don't see anything -- and then, with a shock, we see the first INDIAN.  Naked, painted like an idol, carrying a hunting lance. As if they had materialized from nowhere:  the rest of th HUNTING PARTY, with their bows and spears.  Silent. Watchful.  They stare back at us. The SPANIARDS nervously finger their weapons. COLUMBUS slowly lifts his hand into the air:  a clear signal not to fire.  Then, removing his sword, he drops i on the ground, and starts to walk forward, fixing his gaz upon the first INDIAN he saw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (warningly) Colon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS ignores him, even though some of the INDIANS hav raised their weapons.  He stops in the no-man's land between them.  The INDIANS don't move -- but something excites them. The SHIP'S BOY, wearing COLUMBUS' embroidered jacket and the drum, has followed COLUMBUS and now stands close to him.  He is the cause of their interest.  COLUMBUS puts his arm around the BOY, and this gesture of affection seems to put the INDIANS at their ease.  They start talking and pointing.  They come forward slowly, start to tentatively touch the BOY'S jacket.  Then, now laughing, they touch COLUMBUS, pulling at his beard.  COLUMBUS laughs too. Sensing their innocence, the rest of the MEN lower their weapons.  Some of them laugh. An apparition:  a beautiful young INDIAN GIRL, totally naked, walks out of the jungle. She is pregnant and holds a child.  We begin to hear Indian music, played on a flute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large post is lifted from the ground by two SPANIARDS pulling on ropes.  The post is fixed into position -- and then we see that it is a large wooden cross... The INDIAN VILLAGERS watch the ceremony with some interest and amusement. COLUMBUS looks over at the men and gestures at the INDIANS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have come here in peace, and we will behave with honor.  They are not savages and neither will you be. Treat these people as you would your own wives and your own children. Neither are you free to take what you will; for a seashell you give a bandana.  You will respect their beliefs.  Pillage will be punished by the whip.  Rape by the sword.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The smoke from fires.  Laughter.  Music playing.  The INDIANS have prepared food for the SPANIARDS, who are drinking and enjoying themselves in this strange world. COLUMBUS sits with MENDEZ, PINZON, the INDIAN CHIEF, ELDERS OF THE VILLAGE.  Other INDIANS stand around, smiling, curious. The INDIANS talk among themselves.  The ELDERS smoke primitive cigars -- and offer them, with good humor, to their guests.  The SPANIARDS cough and choke at first... and laugh.  In return, they offer the INDIANS wine... Dogs roam around the campfires.  The WOMEN openly suckle their babies.  The MEN are entranced. PINZON draws out attention, for the first time, to a smal gold ornament on the nose of one of the INDIANS.  He points to it, indicates his interest in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gold...!  Gold!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The INDIANS says the word in his own language, laughing. We see that some of the other INDIANS also have small gol ornaments. PINZON repeats the INDIAN word for gold.  The INDIAN removes the ornament from his nose, gives it to PINZON, who indicates that he wants to have it.  The INDIAN nods -- but points to PINZON'S dagger, indicating that he want it in return.  PINZON shakes his head, stops the INDIAN from taking it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Pinzon) Give it to him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINZON looks at him, about to argue -- but COLUMBUS insists.  PINZON takes out the dagger and offers it to th INDIAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (irritated) By God!  That's the worst trade of my life!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His friends laugh.  Innocently, the INDIAN has taken it b the blade.  He yelps, looks down at the blood welling up... A moment of tension... Then MENDEZ laughs at his clumsiness, and the ELDERS laugh too... and the INDIAN laughs. Just outside this circle, we see the first INDIAN we saw, squatting on his haunches, watching.  This is UTAPAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first light outside -- the strange, wonderful sounds of the jungle all around.  COLUMBUS writes in his journal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
