dialogues.text: October 21st, 1492.  I think we have returned to Eden.  Surely this is how the world once was, before the beginning of time.  I believe no man will ever see this land again as we do, for the first time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up.  UTAPAN is squatting in the doorway of the hut.  He's been there all night.  COLUMBUS takes more ink on his quill and begins to sketch UTAPAN'S face in the margin of his log-book.  He draws well. He gets up and walks over to UTAPAN and shows him the drawing.  It's an electrifying moment.  UTAPAN is shocked and amazed.  At first he is rather frightened of his own image... Then he is happy, and laughs... and COLUMBUS laughs with him and puts a hand on his shoulder in a gesture of friendship. UTAPAN gets up, and indicates that he too has something h wishes to offer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UTAPAN expertly scampering through the jungle.  COLUMBUS follows him. UTAPAN orders COLUMBUS to sit.  COLUMBUS obeys.  UTAPAN looks up at the tops of the trees.  The sun is rising, an filters through the foliage.  As if the time had come, UTAPAN stands up, and COLUMBUS does the same. A gap in the dense vegetation.  Something is glittering. Gold.  A mass of gold.  As they approach, COLUMBUS discovers -- A large pool of fresh water.  The morning sunlight has turned the water into liquid gold.  The surface ripples with the breeze.  UTAPAN smiles.  It the stranger satisfied?  Isn't this what he came for? COLUMBUS plunges into the pool.  As he emerges, he fills his palms with liquid gold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wide shot -- A flotilla of canoes are going upstream. INDIANS AND SPANIARDS are traveling together in the canoes.  UTAPAN leads the expedition in COLUMBUS' craft. THE SHIP BOY'S cranium is shaved like UTAPAN'S, and we notice that some other crew members are beardless, some even wearing tribal patterns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INDIAN VILLAGERS confronting the SPANIARDS, UTAPAN talks to an ELDER MAN, watched by COLUMBUS, MENDEZ and PINZON. UTAPAN repeats several times the word for GOLD, showing some artifacts.  The OLD INDIAN shakes his head no, indicating another distant place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cuba!  Cuba!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE OLD MAN nods, points into the distance, chatters away to UTAPAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say not here!  Cuba!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?  A tribe?  An island?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Island.  Far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing at the prow of the ship, his long dark hair floating in the wind, UTAPAN rejoicing at the speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Led by UTAPAN, the SPANIARDS hack their way through thick jungle.  It's hard work.  The MEN sweat.  This is inhospitable terrain.  Even the noises of the jungle seem somehow more sinister...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RESTING PLACE - ALONSO is seated under a tree.  He takes off his boot, and grabs his foot, examining the blisters on his toes.  As he puts his foot back into the boot, he jumps screaming in pain. ALONSO yelps, grasping his ankle. CLOSE ON a snake sliding out of the empty boot. While his COMPANIONS rush to him, a SAILOR spots the snake, and decapitates it with his sword.  UTAPAN glances at the dead snake.  He then goes and kneels -- he sees th bite on ALONSO'S ankle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALONSO is quiet and silent.  His eyes are looking around at his companions.  UTAPAN shakes his head.  There is nothing he can do. ALONSO is now leaning back, supported by one of his friends.  He has grabbed the forearm of a SAILOR.  His look is already far away.  His companion shouts at UTAPAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do something!  Help him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALONSO starts convulsing.  HIS FRIENDS hold him, desperat in their helplessness.  Others simply move away, horrified.  One of them cries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing in the stream up to his thighs, A SPANIARD (a gold expert) examines some stones.  He then looks up at COLUMBUS and PINZON and just throws the stones back into the water without a word. The group of SPANIARDS are resting, exhausted by the humidity.  Some are drinking from the river, others soak bandanas, and tie them around their necks... One after another, they stand up slowly -- they look discouraged, tired, and beaten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UTAPAN and the SPANIARDS are trekking in the hills.  Full armed, they are now suffering intensely from the heat and the vicious insect bites. COLUMBUS doggedly keeps up with UTAPAN, who tirelessly trots forward. Finally, COLUMBUS turns around and sees... nobody.  He calls out to UTAPAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Utapan!  Wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UTAPAN stops obediently, and rushes back to COLUMBUS with comical energy. On their way back, they find one SOLDIER sitting, leaning against a tree.  He has removed his helmet.  His hair sticking to his forehead. As COLUMBUS and UTAPAN walk back, they find another SAILOR, then another, then the whole group gathered aroun PINZON.  Ashen, he burns with fever.  He attempts a smile

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... You'll have to continue without me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS looks around him -- what he sees:  exhausted men and jungle, as far as one can see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  It's enough.  What would you say to a drop of Jerez, Pinzon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINZON grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a nice slice of Santa Fe lamb! I'd sell my soul for it. (to his officer) Help me up.  I've got to piss, gold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all laugh as the OFFICER helps PINZON to his feet. PINZON walks a few yards into the jungle -- starts to urinate.  It is red.  Suddenly dizzy, he reels and collapses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A line of SPANIARDS and INDIANS threading their way down mountainside.  PINZON is being carried on a makeshift stretcher.  His eyes are closed, his face thick with sweat. They enter a village, to the surprise of the INDIANS. UTAPAN once again at the front as the ambassador.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A INDIAN SHAMAN is forcing a milky fluid into PINZON'S mouth.  COLUMBUS attempts a gesture to prevent him.  But UTAPAN stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He cures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS nods -- he obviously trusts UTAPAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the half-light, figures wreathed in smoke -- COLUMBUS, MENDEZ and UTAPAN watch the CHIEF GUARIONEX putting a Spanish helmet on his head.  The helmet is too big, almos covering his eyes.  The ELDERS appraise the gift with solemn wonder. In return, GUARIONEX hands COLUMBUS a parcel made of leaves.  COLUMBUS unwraps them.  Inside:  a GOLD grimacin mask.  The first real piece of gold.  COLUMBUS is unable to conceal his excitement at this first real evidence of the metal. He waits for the CHIEF to speak, but the CHIEF only looks at him.  On the ground, we see other presents offered by the SPANIARDS -- trinkets, and necklaces...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Columbus) You come!  You speak first!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell the Chief we thank him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him his country is very beautiful.  Tell him we are leaving men here -- to build a fort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UTAPAN translates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him we will return very soon. Many of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UTAPAN translates.  The CHIEF GUARIONEX asks a simple question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief says -- how many?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thousands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS doesn't seem to understand the question.  For th first time he seems to be caught short.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To bring the word of God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief says -- he has a God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pursuing) ... and also to bring medicine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief says...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) He has medicine. (pause) Tell him we admire his people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UTAPAN translates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief says he knows you like his... (searches for the word) Women...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the CHIEF gets up, awards COLUMBUS with a smile, and walks out of the hut, the ELDERS following, leaving COLUMBUS alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a little smile) That's a beginning...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watched from the shore by the INDIANS and by about forty of the SPANIARDS, who are staying behind, the boats pull out towards the two remaining ships. PINZON is laid out in the bottom of the boat.  COLUMBUS, UTAPAN, and four other INDIANS are in the same boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: March 1493... Thirty nine of my men volunteered to stay behind.  God willing we will be back in less than a year...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boats continue to pull away, the figures on the shore growing smaller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON:  a golden mask... the lamp in the cabin swings violently back and forth, creating strange shadows, as if the mask was alive... COLUMBUS is writing with difficulty in his log-book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Several men are ill.  We did not find signs of civilization.  No cities, no temples... Nothing that resembles Marco Polo's descriptions. My ships are not filled with the spices and the gold that Spain was hoping for.  But this land intoxicates the senses like the strongest of perfumes... And all I can think of, is to return to these untamed lands...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the cabin seems to lurch over.  Things fall from the table, smashing on the floor... COLUMBUS nearly falls

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are in the middle of a violent storm -- of terrifying proportions.  The thunder is deafening.  Light irradiates the darkness.  We see the two caravels, dwarfed by the massive seas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five MEN are struggling to lash down the tiller.  The dec jumps and rolls.  It rises five meters into the air then falls into space and hits the water with a terrible crack Waves sweep over the decks.  We hear desperate cries for mercy from the terrified crew, loud enough to be heard above the storm. COLUMBUS and MENDEZ are crawling towards the mast, along lifeline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming to the sailors) Get below!  All of you!  Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MEN start to scramble below decks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mendez) Stay with me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship rolls again.  COLUMBUS and MENDEZ crawl towards the mast.  Another gigantic wave crashes over them, tons of water falling like cement.  They reach the mast.  The wood groans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We may have to cut it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MENDEZ nods... COLUMBUS grabs some rope.  The ship rises into the air again, crashes down, the deck disappearing beneath them for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming out) I'll stay here -- to decide if we cut it.  Help me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With MENDEZ'S help, COLUMBUS is tied to the mast:  one rope under his arms, the other around his waist.  MENDEZ hands him a horn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) Now go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MENDEZ seems to hesitate.  COLUMBUS screams at him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said -- below deck, Mendez!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MENDEZ crawls away. Another huge wave washes over COLUMBUS.  He emerges, almost suffocated.  The storm rages, its eerie light making it seem at times like bright daylight.  But as the lightning flashes, COLUMBUS begins to count:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One... two... three... four...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's an enormous thunderclap on "four" -- it indicates how close they are to the eye of the storm. The ship keels over again, dropping down and down, seemin never to rise... COLUMBUS lifts his head to the heavens, screams out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As if in answer, another flash of lightning that illuminates the sky and the sea.  COLUMBUS starts countin again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One... two... three... four... five...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another terrible clap of thunder on "five" -- COLUMBUS starts laughing, knowing the storm is moving on. Then, in the strange light, something seems to move through the air towards him; it looks like some kind of projectile, a craft, with a trail of vapor. COLUMBUS stares up at it... amazed.  We start to hear the "Te Deum", majestic and heavenly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS looks up at the vast roof, to see an incense burner, swinging, gliding swiftly across the ceiling, trailing a think vapor of incense. A magnificent "Te Deum" is being sung -- in honor of COLUMBUS' achievements and return.  The whole cathedral i packed with nobles and dignitaries in their gorgeous robes. BEATRIX, FERNANDO and DIEGO are staring in fascination at COLUMBUS' triumph -- somewhat separated by the grandeur o this occasion.  COLUMBUS passes by, walking proudly down the long central alley, beside KING FERDINAND and QUEEN ISABEL and other GRANDEES.  He turns to his family, keeping his eyes on BEATRIX until she is out of his vision. The procession is followed by UTAPAN, and other INDIANS i tribal regalia... As they move through the crowds, all eyes are upon COLUMBUS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a simple room, a PRIEST finishes giving the Last Rites and a sheet is pulled over the head of MARTIN PINZON.  Hi WIFE and CHILDREN weep at the bedside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stool passes from hands to hands.  It is placed at the Queen and King's side.  COLUMBUS sits on it -- a supreme privilege. To one side sit AROJAZ and SANCHEZ.  AROJAZ leans over to whisper to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't be easy to get rid of your prophet now, Don Sanchez.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) On the contrary, Your Eminence.  It seems to me the man is preparing his own cross.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON:  the face of a young, SPANISH NOBLEMAN, ADRIAN DE MOXICA.  Hesitantly, he brings a lighted cigar to his lips -- then pauses. We discover other people around the magnificent candle-li table.  NOBLE MEN and NOBLE WOMEN.  SANCHEZ.  COLUMBUS. QUEEN ISABEL. COLUMBUS takes the cigar from MOXICA.  The rest watch him with rapt curiosity.  COLUMBUS inhales deeply then, to their astonishment, blows out the smoke through his nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must not inhale, but simply allow the palate to enjoy the flavor of the Tobacco...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands the cigar back to MOXICA.  With a casual air, MOXICA himself inhales deeply -- almost chokes to death. He gulps down a glass of wine... much to the amusement of the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deeply embarrassed) And you say this is an Indian vice? By God!  I don't see any kind of pleasure that would make this a sin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Indians have no such word, Don Moxica.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do they have such thoughts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They come and go as naked as the day God created them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ISABEL blushes slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't see sin in their nakedness.  They live according to nature, in a never ending summer. The islands are covered with trees, filled with blossoms and fruits. And...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Forgive me, Don Colon.  But what about gold?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS nods, turns and whispers something to a SERVANT standing just behind his chair.  The SERVANT goes to open the door -- and in comes UTAPAN, dressed as a tribesman, carrying a casket.  The WOMEN around the table fan themselves furiously at the sight.  UTAPAN puts the caske down in front of the QUEEN, and steps back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are gifts for Your Majesty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ISABEL opens the casket, revealing the gleam of gold inside.  She takes out some of the little golden ornaments... a bracelet and then the mask. She holds it, somehow moved by its crude beauty. ISABEL raises the mask to her face, looking across at COLUMBUS. The image is somehow powerful enough to reduce even the ARISTOCRATS to silence.  She speaks from behind the mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are more than gratified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guests laugh obsequiously.  COLUMBUS bows a little -- looks up and meets the eyes of SANCHEZ, who is staring at him, coldly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SWORD MASTER advances towards us with determination, hi sword flashing.  He is fighting an adversary we do not see, and comments his movements.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Si!  Si!  Muy bien!  Excellente! (Yes!  Yes!  Good!  Excellent!)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We discover the SWORD MASTER is fencing with COLUMBUS.  A dozen duellists are practicing in the magnificent rotunda surrounded with a two-tiered colonnade. Out of breath, COLUMBUS stops the exercise, and removes his protective canvas padding.  He bows at his teacher, who salutes him in return. COLUMBUS walks to a tressel laden with food and beverages SANCHEZ, in a fencing outfit and boots, is having a glass of wine.  Upon seeing COLUMBUS approaching, he hands him glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You defend yourself admirably...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... for a commoner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SANCHEZ laughs and raises his glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To your second expedition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They drink.  A short, somewhat ugly man, with some kind o imposing energy, approach them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don Colon -- Don Alonso de Bobadilla.  A man who knows our laws.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOBADILLA bows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand that you will soon be appointing Governors for the islands?  Is it not so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgive me, Don Bobadilla -- those positions have already been taken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disappointed) May I ask by whom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bartolome and Giacomo Colon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SANCHEZ looks at him in surprise.  BOBADILLA reddens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I trust they are men of quality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOBADILLA glances at SANCHEZ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we do have a lack of notaries. You should contact my administration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amused) Don Bobadilla is already a judge, my Dear Don Cristobal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good!  We are also in need of judges.  Except there are no thieves!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A grin disfigures the face of BOBADILLA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sanchez) I see I was mistaken.  Don Colon has no need for my services...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he walks off.  SANCHEZ fills his mouth with a slice o ham.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amused) You seem to have a special talent for making friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What...?  Do I have so many already?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seriously) To rise so high, in so short a time, is a dangerous occupation. (kindly) A little hypocrisy goes a long way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS with two MEN:  the oldest, around thirty, is a strong-looking man.  The youngest, no more than twenty five, is thin and fit.  There is obvious tension in the room.  These are BARTOLOME and GIACOMO COLON, COLUMBUS' brothers.  BARTOLOME is angry, and GIACOMO thoughtful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might have given us a choice!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bartolome is stronger, more capable than I will ever be...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need both of you.  What are you afraid of?  We are living what we always dreamt of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I never shared those dreams with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you saying you refuse to help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS looks at them with such pained surprise...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amused) You bastard... you always had your own way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me show you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens the door to a terrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The large gallery courtyard is crowded with PEOPLE -- applicants for the voyage.  As COLUMBUS appears, they all press forward, calling out his name, trying to get his attention, touching his sleeves as if he were a saint. They crowd around COLUMBUS and his BROTHERS.  COLUMBUS nods, murmurs vaguely, here and there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course... Of course... We'll see to it... Yes... Thank you... Soon... Soon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fighting their way through, the BOTHERS press their way, reaching the other side of the gallery.  We get glimpses of the incredible activity down below.  ADMINISTRATORS, MILITARIES, MERCHANTS are busy around tressels covered with documents, plans, maps... preparing the second expedition. COLUMBUS puts his arms around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating the applicants) Now -- you tell me.  Who can I trust? (almost amused) We're brothers!  We must be a House. A bloodline!  In this country one can't exist alone!  I need you...! Both of you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks then to the balustrade.  The cries from the courtyard down below subside... some of the applicants begin to look up, aware of his presence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is the Admiral?  Has anyone seen the Admiral?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is here!  What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans over the balcony.  In the middle of the overcrowded courtyard, the SOLDIER who was shouting is brandishing a document.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admiral!  The horses have arrived.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  I saw them!  Who did we hire today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANOTHER ASSISTANT raises his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty blacksmiths, twenty eight halberdiers, twenty carpenters, a hundred farmers, twenty miners... and Doctor Chanca, the royal surgeon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The royal surgeon?  Then we can count on royal health!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole courtyard bursts out laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UTAPAN is lying in his hammock.  FERNANDO turns him over. UTAPAN falls to the ground. COLUMBUS walks beside BEATRIX.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at his son) He's growing up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEATRIX smiles, nods.  They walk on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beatrix, I want to ask you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a smile) You don't usually ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a pause) I can arrange for the Queen to take Fernando and Diego into her service.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEATRIX stops in her tracks, looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a great honor.  We could not hope for anything better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEATRIX nods, but bites her lip, and looks back at FERNANDO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For once I wish you weren't right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS puts his arm around her waist, pulling her closer, they move away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FERNANDO is now swinging expertly in the hammock.  UTAPAN is pushing him gently.  He slowly straightens up to watch COLUMBUS and BEATRIX disappear, somehow sensing there is dilemma.  FERNANDO noticing UTAPAN'S reaction, turns to his parents.  The arbor is empty.  FERNANDO becomes pensive. We become aware of the rustling of the jungle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIFTEEN HUNDRED MEN spread along the beach, looking towards the jungle.  COLUMBUS stands beside his BROTHERS, and MENDEZ, and UTAPAN. MOXICA, astride a magnificent black horse, prances back and forth across the sand.  All are waiting. A signal cannon is fired from one of the ships.  Birds scatter into the air from the jungle -- but then silence, complete and ominous.  COLUMBUS stares into the jungle. Nothing.  No one to greet them -- no welcoming party from the MEN they left behind. COLUMBUS glances at MENDEZ. MENDEZ looks at him, but can't answer. MOXICA suddenly spurs on his horse, and guides it into th trees.  The order is given for the rest to follow, fannin out as they do so, weapons at the ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruins.  The camp has been burned to ashes.  A strange sight:  arrows are stuck vertically into the ground, each with a moldering tuft of human hair attached to the flight. In silence the SOLDIERS pick their way through the devastation. The ground is littered with coconuts.  Kicking one over with his shoe, a SOLDIER discovers that his coconut is actually a human skull.  The gaping mouth has been filled to the brim with gold. But of the living, there is no sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this your new world, Don Colon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS looks around in dismay.  A YOUNG NOBLEMAN, HERNANDO DE GUEVARA, takes out his sword.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These animals should be shown what savagery can be!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other SPANIARDS join in, repeating this last word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three heads for every life taken. No mercy before God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No mercy!  Let's find them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Guevara.  There will be no revenge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.  Everyone looks at COLUMBUS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We lost cousins, friends.  We will wash this in blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want to keep your head on your shoulders, you'll do as I say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are all listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moxica, I lost friends too... Thirty nine brave men who trusted me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks among them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want a war?  Fine.  We are a thousand.  They outnumber us by ten! Who will you kill?  Which tribe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't need to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We came here to stay!  To build! Not to start a crusade.  In this forest, there is enough danger to sweep us away in days!  So we will be brave and swallow our grief.  And in the name of those who died, we will accomplish what we came for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOXICA mounted on his magnificent BLACK STALLION canters to the edge of the deserted village and enters the village.  UTAPAN is terrorized by the absence of anything living. All we can hear is the breathing of the horse.  The animal, an impressive mass of muscle, prances nervously. UTAPAN calls out in dialect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly, they begin to appear, one after the other -- materializing from the jungle.  Shy and scared. They stare at this "Centaur" (the HORSE and the HORSEMAN seem to be one -- a God). To impress them even more, MOXICA makes the beast move sideways and backwards, rearing, its front hoofs pawing the air.  THE INDIANS retreat in terror, except for one, who stands his ground, brandishing his lance. UTAPAN encourages the YOUNG WARRIOR to approach the centaur.  He places his hand onto the shoulder of the animal.  The muscles shudder.  THE INDIAN jumps back comically, accompanied by the rest of the tribe. Without warning, MOXICA climbs down from the saddle.  Mor INDIANS step back in fear and absolute astonishment.  Now more have ventured from the jungle.  The bravest of them approach MOXICA, daring to touch him, and the horse, retreating then touching until they fill the compound. At this moment, COLUMBUS and his SOLDIERS appear all around them, pointing their muskets, and their crossbows. A moment of tension. COLUMBUS walks forward, towards the CHIEF (GUARIONEX) we meet before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask the Chief what happened to my men?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CHIEF answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another tribe made war on them... came by sea... took them away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God have mercy on their souls...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The monkey is lying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause.  The SPANIARDS shifting, eager for blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should kill them, Don Colon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UTAPAN looks anxiously at COLUMBUS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...!  you'll do it my way. (to Utapan) Tell the Chief we will not harm his people, even though we have the power to do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UTAPAN translates.  The CHIEF listens in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will work with his people.  We want peace.  Ask the Chief if he understands?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He understands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask him if he will help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is raining hard.  COLUMBUS is floundering in the mud, supervising a mixed work-force of SPANISH and INDIANS. They are attempting to raise the huge wheel of a watermill. Despite COLUMBUS' shouts of encouragement, it's clear the wheel is far too heavy and the mud too deep. Close by, on horseback, MOXICA watches the scene. COLUMBUS, plastered with wet mud, clambers out of the pit and approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don Moxica -- we need your horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOXICA looks down at the sodden, dirty figure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't raise the wheel without it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My horse doesn't work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.  COLUMBUS wipes some mud from his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don Moxica -- we all have to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did not hear me, Don Colon.  Not my horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to turn away; COLUMBUS grabs hold of the reins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgive me, Don Moxica.  But it was your horse I was talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.  MOXICA stares down at an equally determined COLUMBUS.  Then, in front of everyone, MOXICA has to dismount, and suffer the disgrace of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Don Moxica.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS leads the horse away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harnessed, the horse pulls, with COLUMBUS and the MEN. The wheel is raised into position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water thundering into the new canal.  The huge wheel begins to turn.  The MEN cheer and congratulate each other.  MOXICA looks at his mud-splattered and foaming horse, his eyes full of hatred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wide, high shot of the new "City", dominated by a huge wooden cross -- no more than a muddy main street bordered by a hundred bamboo and stone shanties, with candles burning in the doorways.  A main square with the Governor's Mansion, and the foundations of a church. In the twilight, COLUMBUS and the other WORKERS returning dirty and tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOXICA and GUEVARA sit out on the "veranda", watching the MEN return.  MOXICA raises his glass in an ironic salute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the Governor of the Mosquitoes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They laugh.  We see the smoke and flames from a fire. Four or five INDIANS are squatting on the earth nearby, cooking for them, talking quietly in their own language. MOXICA calls out something in their language, and a naked YOUNG INDIAN GIRL comes out of the house, bringing more wine.  GUEVARA stares at her lasciviously.  MOXICA, letting his hand casually brush against her flank, smiles at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns the GIRL round so that GUEVARA can admire her properly.  GUEVARA nods.  MOXICA lets the GIRL go with a peremptory order, and she disappears back inside. GUEVARA suddenly stands up -- unsteadily -- and sweeping his arm round in a broad gesture, says ironically:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the new world, my friend!  To the new world!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In an already Spanish-colonel dining room, COLUMBUS is having dinner with his brothers, BARTOLOME and GIACOMO, served by an INDIAN WOMAN -- NIMA.  GIACOMO eats with gusto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as Nima pours the wine) Nima's a good cook!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's more than that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seeing GIACOMO'S sudden blush and discomfort, as NIMA smiles at him, the other BROTHERS laugh. To cover his embarrassment, GIACOMO returns to the topic of the food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eat!  I'll tell you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he sees BARTOLOME stifling a laugh, GIACOMO pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to know what I'm eating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS eats a mouthful, glances at BARTOLOME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iguana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A look of horror crosses GIACOMO'S face; he wretches slightly, puts down his fork, and gulps down some wine. The BROTHERS laugh again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What wrong with it?  The Indians eat it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not an Indian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wishes he were back in the seminary.  Priests always eat well. (tasting his wine, grimacing) And they have very good cellars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing grows here!  Everything rots in the ground.  The wheat and vines wither before we can harvest them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got to learn to live like the Indians. (pause) Eat your Iguana!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reluctantly this time, GIACOMO goes back to his dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are drinking and smoking cigars.  From the balcony they can see the dark mass of the jungle stretching away. GIACOMO is already dozing in his chair.  BARTOLOME sees it, and elbows COLUMBUS.  They both smile at their younge brother's exhaustion.  Then COLUMBUS gets up and leans on the balustrade, looking down at the city, the jungle beyond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much gold have we found?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not enough to justify a single shipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps it doesn't exist anywhere but in my imagination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then let's hope not... (pause) What will happen if we can't find enough gold?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They begin to hear the sound of a flute -- a melancholy sound.  COLUMBUS looks out over the jungle, and kills a mosquito by slapping his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jokingly) Then I'm Governor of the Mosquitoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An INDIAN is playing the flute. In the gloomy interior of the long hut, in the most primitive conditions, DOZENS OF SPANIARDS lie sick.  On a segregated part of the room are the INDIANS, several coughing. They are attended by a doctor, DOCTOR CHANCA, BROTHER BUYL, and other NOVICES. A NOVICE attends to an INDIAN, gently lifting his head, helping him to drink -- there is so little they can do. BROTHER BUYL looks down at the body of a SPANIARD, covere in open sores.  The NOVICE joins him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of disease is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  It seems almost as if we have exchanged diseases with the Indians.  They die of our most common cold, and we of their plague.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God forgive us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAN covered with sores is screaming, thrashing in his agony.  He is held down, his voice muffled.  ISABEL turns away, shocked. She is in a ward full of patients, attended by a DOCTOR, SANCHEZ and other members of her court. The patients are emaciated, their faces and bodies covere with virulent sores.  NUNS move between the beds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It seems to be caused by intimacy with the native women, Your Majesty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will he survive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Your Majesty.  They go mad -- then they die.  There is nothing we can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ISABEL looks around at SANCHEZ, appalled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every ship returns with a cargo of sick and dying.  But with no gold! The new world proves expensive, Your Majesty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We weren't expecting immediate profits, were we?  We must have faith.  We must give time for time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SANCHEZ bows in acknowledgement.  But ISABEL, despite her words, looks distressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excavations carved into a hillside. It is a blisteringly hot day.  At the foot of the hill, GIACOMO sits at a table beneath an awning, with MOXICA an several CLERKS.  ONE HUNDRED FIFTY INDIANS standing in line at the table. In turn, they hand over a small quantity of gold.  The CLERK weighs it on a scale, and notes down each contribution. MOXICA impatiently gestures the INDIANS to move faster with a thonged crop.  An INDIAN approaches the table.  He is nervous.  He doesn't produce anything.  The INDIAN shakes his head, gesticulates, starts to speak rapidly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says he has not found any!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's lying!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again the INDIAN pleads and gesticulates.  MOXICA hits hi across the face with the thonged crop.  The INDIAN tries to run away -- but is held by a SPANISH SOLDIER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring him here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The frightened INDIAN is brought back to the table.  One of the CLERKS slips away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him to put his hands on the table.  Like this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the other end of the site, the CLERK sprinting to GIACOMO, who was talking to a FOREMASTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don Giacomo, you'd better come at once!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOXICA turns, looks back at the long line of INDIANS, still passively waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell them I want them to watch this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The terrified TRANSLATOR speaks to the INDIANS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't Moxica!  You can't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GIACOMO and the CLERK running to the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the clerk) I can't?  I can't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a single swift action, MOXICA draws his sword and cuts off the INDIAN'S hands. ALL HELL BREAKS LOOSE.  The INDIANS flee, disappearing into the jungle.  GIACOMO arrives at this moment.  He stares at the dismembered hands in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tribunal.  Sitting behind a table with his brothers, an flanked by his council, COLUMBUS presides.  MOXICA stands before them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In one act of brutality, you have created chaos.  Tribes who were fighting each other are now joining forces against us!  All that because of your criminal savagery!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (casually) Savagery is what monkeys understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be held in detention, deprived of your privileges and possessions.  Until you are returned to Spain where you will be judged. Have you anything to say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with exquisite insolence) You will regret this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He strolls to the GUARDS at the back of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything is quiet on the mine site. On the terrace, TWO SOLDIERS are drinking in turn, and cracking jokes.  One of them leans against the wooden wall.  He laughs as he hears repeated banging behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A THIRD SOLDIER is fucking an INDIAN WOMAN against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the terrace, his two COMPANIONS laugh and encourage his efforts. A whooshing sound.  An arrow embeds itself in the chest o the SOLDIER who was leaning against the wall.  He is nailed to the wood behind him. THE OTHER SOLDIER stares at him, transfixed, until an arrow pierces his throat.  He collapses, unable to cry out for help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOUR INDIANS in full warrior outfit, their faces painted, burst into the room.  Still busy with the WOMAN, his eyes facing the wall, the SOLDIER believes the intruders to be his friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (without stopping) You animals!  Can't you wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Discovering the FOUR TERRIFYING FIGURES staring at her, the INDIAN WOMAN starts screaming and pushes back the SOLDIER.  He turns around, jumps off the WOMAN, and start to scramble to the front door, trying to put on his trousers. THE FOUR INDIANS catch him, and force him to lay on the ground.  THE MAN struggles, his eyes rolling in terror. TWO INDIANS force his mouth open.  A THIRD ONE kneels and starts stuffing it with gold dust.  THE SOLDIER chokes an suffocates. THE WOMAN still stands half naked against the wall, terrified.  AN INDIAN takes his knife from his leggings, slowly.  She starts sobbing and imploring in her language THE INDIAN slowly walks to her, and plants the knife in the lower part of her belly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAIRS of bloody red legs hanging still, high in the air. Pulling back, we discover: A DOZEN SPANIARDS have been crucified on the scaffolding of the excavations.  Some hands and noses have been removed. UTAPAN is standing, uncomfortable among the SPANIARDS. A SOLDIER removes a huge iron nail from a wrist.  One of the CRUCIFIED BODIES is gently laid on the ground.  He is still alive -- not for long. COLUMBUS and BARTOLOME are silent with rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aggressively) Moxica is right.  Our ways don't work!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARTOLOME turns to UTAPAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aggressively) Can you find them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UTAPAN looks distraught -- this is the first time he is being asked to do something against his own people.  He looks up at COLUMBUS for help in confusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to find them, Utapan.  Look what they did!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did the same to your God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS is caught short.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to stop this war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UTAPAN nods.  He walks and takes an arrow.  He examines it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UTAPAN nods, uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Around a campfire, two dozen INDIANS are squatting.  They are arguing over a musket and some woolen hats they stole from the mine.  CLICK!  CLICK!  The INDIANS raise their heads.  All around them, crossbows and muskets are pointe at them.  Two INDIANS try to run away.  They are shot. This sound triggers the SPANIARDS' response.  They start shooting at random.  UTAPAN is horrified.  COLUMBUS stand up shouting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop!  Stop this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOXICA and a group of rebels (GUEVARA among them), silently approach the entrance of the mansion. A GUARD is stabbed and falls on his knees with a cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOXICA tears COLUMBUS' plans of the city from the wall. On the table, the model of the future city. Watched by the other ARISTOCRATS, MOXICA sets fire to the parchment he has rolled up.  He blows the flames from the torch onto the model.  Fire races up and down the streets of the miniature, as if burning the city of Isabel. A mad gleam in MOXICA'S eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The half-burnt remains of the Mansion.  COLUMBUS stands i the square, looking up at it.  Behind him, his SOLDIERS, his BROTHERS and about thirty captured INDIANS. GIACOMO walks slowly across the square.  COLUMBUS looks a him in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through cracked lips) Moxica...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS leads his party of SOLDIERS through the jungle, looking for the MUTINEERS. They reach the river -- scan the far bank.  Nothing. COLUMBUS nods.  His MEN start to enter the river, led by HALBERDIER. Others follow, wading across, their weapons held above their heads. A crossbow arrow pierces the HALBERDIER.  Without a cry h falls forward into the water, and is carried away by the current. Two more MEN are hit.  One cries out, thrashes around in the water, an arrow protruding from his side.  The river stained with blood. Still no sign of the enemy.  COLUMBUS' MEN nevertheless start to return fire from the bank, creating a shield... others continue to wade across the river.  A MUTINEER is shot down from the branches of a tree... The first MEN come ashore.  Musket fire.  An exchange of arrows.  COLUMBUS is now wading across.  The MAN next to him is killed, and carried away by the current. Now, on the far shore, the enemy have shown themselves. There is hand to hand fighting, with swords and other weapons.  MOXICA kills one of COLUMBUS' men -- but his ow are outnumbered and outmatched.  Already, some are beginning to surrender. In the midst of the fighting, COLUMBUS, sword drawn, pull himself out of the river:  A MUTINEER lunges at him. COLUMBUS kills him with a thrust of his sword -- and walk forward into the jungle.  He spots MOXICA at the foot of cliff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOXICA starts scrambling up the rocks behind him, with COLUMBUS following.  The climb through the dense undergrowth is so exhausting, they are now almost climbin in slow motion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOXICA bursts out of the undergrowth.  He is at the edge of emptiness, swept by a violent offshore wind.  He turns frantically, to see COLUMBUS coming up behind him. Knowing he is lost, MOXICA regains his natural arrogance. He steps backwards towards the edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what they will say in Spain about my death -- don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes another step backwards, as COLUMBUS moves toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are nothing!  You bastards will never inherit your titles.  We are everything.  We are immortal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles, and steps back into space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His body falls, bounces off the rocks below, crashes into the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS stares down as his body is swept away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON COLUMBUS' expressionless face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MUTINEER -- his face is white, he is crying and trembling.  His arms are tied behind his back.  He is hel fast, a rope is put around his neck. COLUMBUS, sitting not far away beside his BROTHERS, gives a signal. Drums begin to beat.  BROTHER BUYL looks on impassive. A grimace suddenly transform THE YOUNG MAN'S face.  He is being garroted -- his throat crushed with a rope.  The YOUNG MAN'S feet dance frenziedly.  We hear the choking. The drums cease.  BROTHER BUYL crosses himself and murmur a prayer, deeply distraught.  GIACOMO has covered his eyes. A wider view shows the bodies of three other ARISTOCRATS from the rebellion, attached to chairs affixed to a pole, their heads straight, the rope still tight around their necks. Justice has been done.  The members of the COUNCIL rise i silence, COLUMBUS stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON several large wooden cages.  Inside we see the INDIANS that COLUMBUS captured.  They are packed together They stare out with vacant eyes.  SOLDIERS guard them.  A ship against the pier.  BUYL at his side, COLUMBUS stares at the INDIANS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish to go back with them, Don Colon.  I have no desire to remain in this godless place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may do as you please, Brother Buyl -- though your departure will not help me to make it more Godly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BROTHER BUYL looks at him, almost with astonishment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You treat Christians equally with heathen savages.  You execute members of the nobility.  And what do you offer in return?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) A new world, Brother Buyl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody wants one...!  Only you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Against the livid horizon, three black waterspouts join the sky to the sea.  A gust of wind disturbs the roof of the jungle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wind grows stronger.  Doors bang inside the building... a melancholy sound. COLUMBUS sits on the balcony with his BROTHERS.  They are silent.  After a few moments, COLUMBUS begins to speak quietly, almost as if he were speaking to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps hope only exists in the journey.  When it begins, everything is still possible -- every expectation; every dream...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BROTHERS do not answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not how I imagined it to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UTAPAN begins to shave his head...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky is dark and threatening, the wind even stronger. We find COLUMBUS where we left him, but now alone.  He ha sat here all night. Shutters bang violently. He looks up -- and sees a few yards from him:  the naked FIGURE OF AN INDIAN, his face and body painted, staring a him.  COLUMBUS realizes who it is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Utapan!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UTAPAN is still and silent.  A strange and mysterious figure now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Utapan, won't you speak to me?  You used to know how to speak to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sadly, in his own language) You never learned how to speak my language.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UTAPAN is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wind is whipping the trees now, stronger and stronger Groups of INDIANS look up at the sky.  Then, above the sound of the wind, they hear another noise.  Like a collective murmur, almost in one voice, the INDIANS repeat, over and over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Urracan... Urracan... Urracan... Urracan... (the wrath of God)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a loud thunderclap, the storm suddenly breaks.  In a few seconds it has risen to violent proportions, and the landscape is drenched in torrential rain.  The wind doubles its strength... and all hell breaks loose...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hurricane is full force.  Trees are being ripped up b their roots.  Rivers of mud are washed down from the hills, carrying everything away in their paths:  houses, carts, equipment, horses...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mine workings flooded with mud...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS, BARTOLOME and MENDEZ struggle through the teeth of the hurricane towards the dam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Timbers creak and strain.  COLUMBUS, BARTOLOME, MENDEZ an a DOZEN other MEN are trying to save the dam. Suddenly, frighteningly, the dam begins to crash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) Let it go!  Let it go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MEN scramble away as the dam wall buckles, and burst open.  Water floods over them; a roaring torrent.  From the bank, MENDEZ, BARTOLOME and COLUMBUS survey the ruins of their dreams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS is stretched out on his bed, in his devastated bedroom.  A column of ants is threading its way across th floor, each ant carrying a piece of leaf.  Rain falls ove a table covered with documents. COLUMBUS' face is covered in dried mud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He promised us gold but has failed to find it.  He subjects the natives to violence, provocation and injustice.  He sent them to Spain against the express wishes of Your Majesty...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are back to the first scene.  In the vast, opulent, glittering room, ISABEL listens impassively to the voice of SANCHEZ.  Also present, other GRANDEES, representative of the church and state.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... But there is worse.  He ordered the execution of five members of the nobility...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this true, Brother Buyl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Your Majesty.  It is all true. I saw it with my own eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause.  ISABEL seems to struggle inwardly with her emotions.  SANCHEZ waits, expressionless, but on the poin of victory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, what do you suggest, Don Sanchez?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He must be replaced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And who would you think of, for such a task?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a buckled shoe -- as it rises, it slips into a stirrup.  The horse is mounted.  The shoe digs into its flank.  The sound of hoofbeats...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am thinking of a man.  A devotee to Your Majesties.  A man extremely motivated...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIVE MEN on HORSEBACK, dressed in fashionable clothes, canter down what used to be the main street of Isabel. Through some has been rebuilt, the effects of the hurricane are still visible... People look at them curiously.  We see them stop near the Governor's mansion.  The MEN dismount and walk into the Palace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the MEN in black clothes removes his hat and steps forward.  We recognize him as ALONSO DE BOBADILLA, the ma COLUMBUS humiliated at the rotunda. COLUMBUS is sitting at his desk, studying plans with GIACOMO.  Some other MEMBERS of the COUNCIL are with them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don Alonso de Bobadilla.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... I remember...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOBADILLA turns, gestures to one of the other MEN, who comes forward and gives him a roll of parchment, bearing the royal seal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My letters of appointment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Appointment to what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viceroy of the West Indies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations.  Then I am free to search for the mainland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOBADILLA smiles wickedly, happy to give COLUMBUS a low blow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't you learn?  The mainland was discovered.  Weeks ago.  By another Italian.  I forgot his name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amerigo Vespucci, Excellency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS pales.  Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How far from here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not a seaman.  But I heard it is no more than a week at sea.  I hope you are not too disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could I be?  The mainland has been found.  Exactly as I said it would.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am afraid this is not the worst news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All is dark.  We can just make out COLUMBUS' face as he lies on the hard bed.  He is sweating heavily; his beard is filthy and matted, like his hair.  He looks feverish. A key turns in the lock. The JAILER lets in two fashionably dressed YOUNG MEN. COLUMBUS, blinking in the light, turns his head to stare at them.  His eyes are reddened with infection at the corners.  The YOUNG MEN come forward into the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unable to believe it, COLUMBUS slowly sits up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fernando...!  My God...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He laughs, overcome with joy.  Embraces DIEGO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man!  Diego, how did this happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Santangel is going to see the Queen. We are going to get you out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good!  I have to go back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIEGO and FERNANDO look at one another, then back at COLUMBUS, incredulously, seeing his filthy clothes, his eyes rimmed with dried mucus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a new excitement in COLUMBUS' voice.  He walks over to the table.  The candlelight illuminates maps, charts, drawings, figures...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to explore the mainland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time with me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS laughs and DIEGO looks at them both in astonishment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In your present state it is madness, Father!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FERNANDO glances at DIEGO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody is forcing you to come with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIEGO is hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't go anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's very beautiful!  The Queen has very good taste.  Diego is getting married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIEGO seems saddened by his brother's attitude.  Once again DIEGO feels like the outsider. COLUMBUS hugs him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am happy for you, Diego.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like Lucifer and Gabriel, SANTANGEL and SANCHEZ sit on either side of ISABEL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Granted his faults.  Yes, a hundred times!  But the man is still remarkable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ISABEL looks at him, then at SANCHEZ, MOVED BUT CLEARLY UNDECIDED.  SANTANGEL presses his point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All he asks is a chance to explore this... mainland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It does not belong to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) In a way, it does, Don Sanchez. (to the Queen) I beg Your Majesty to receive him. To hear him... He will make no more demands.  He has changed.  He is penitent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Penitent...?  He is suing us for breach of contract!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SANTANGEL tries to stop himself laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS is shown into the room.  ISABEL is waiting for him. He drops to his knees before her.  This time she walks towards him, clearly moved by his white-hair, and other signs of physical deterioration. Her hand hovers over his head, as if it means to console him.  Her hand is dying to comfort.  But instead, she offers her hand for him to kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rise... Please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS gets slowly to his feet -- but his eyes, as they meet hers, are as clear as before.  ISABEL smiles with relief to see it.  He looks back at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I do look older than you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles -- then again, tries to restrain it, and keeps her dignity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have decided to allow you to undertake another voyage to the new world...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS starts to interrupt; she stops him with a gesture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But without your brothers.  Nor are you to return to Santo Domingo or any of the other colonies.  You may explore the continent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is one thing I'd like to understand... Why do you want to go back, after all this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Majesty -- some men are content to read about things.  I must see them with my own eyes.  I cannot be other than I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She almost bursts out laughing -- only pauses, turns slightly, then goes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SANCHEZ is standing alone in the next room; he has obviously been listening.  He looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I should not tolerate his impertinence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because he is not afraid of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SANCHEZ, in another direction, along a corridor, towards his office.  As he reaches a corner with a wide window, a hand seizes him.  COLUMBUS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I have to do is call the guards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SANCHEZ looks at him -- and doesn't call.  COLUMBUS lets go of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not afraid of you.  You are nothing but a dreamer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look out of that window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprised, SANCHEZ nevertheless turns, looks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roofs... towers, palaces... spires...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of them created by people like me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SANCHEZ turns round again to face him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No matter how long you live, Sanchez, there's something that will never change between us.  I did it! You didn't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS turns abruptly and walks away, vanishing down th echoing corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS dismounts in the courtyard.  Everything seems deserted.  There's no one about, no sign of life...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS walks slowly through the great rooms.  There is nothing left:  no furniture, rugs, pictures... nothing. He turns, sees BEATRIX standing in a doorway, looking bac at him.  They are both moved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God... you're so beautiful!  I can't believe no other man has ever taken you away from me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They tried... but I didn't let them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles.  They don't dare to touch.  BEATRIX looks round the empty room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They took everything...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at her) Not everything... Do you think I care?  I'm a free man again.  Riches don't make a man rich, they only make him busier...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They laugh.  There's a pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, how much I've missed you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they throw themselves into each other's arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All that has been left is a simple table and one chair. They are having supper by candlelight in the vast, empty room, though the candles throw a warm, sensuous glow on the figs and hams and wine... and on their faces, as BEATRIX sits on his lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One chair.  One table.  What more can a man expect, when he tries to sue the Crown?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They laugh.  With only a little embarrassment, BEATRIX gets off COLUMBUS' knee.  SANTANGEL comes forward, and COLUMBUS embraces him like an old friend.  BEATRIX goes t the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I owe you everything, Santangel... but as you see, I can't repay you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the contrary.  It is I who owe you everything.  Through you, I have been an adventurer, an explorer! It's true I shall never see the new world... but it's here... (he points to his head) And here... (pointing to his heart)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS smiles.  BEATRIX returns with a plate and glass for SANTANGEL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you are, Colon, is a sailor, a discoverer, a man of imagination... not a politician.  You weren't meant to govern -- You cannot be all things to all men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes the wine BEATRIX offers, and raises his glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish you could have compromised. It would have made your life easier...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But as least we haven't been bored, have we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all laugh, and drink.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Night on the open sea -- the moon shines on the waves and we hear the creaking of ropes and timbers -- the loneliness and mystery of the night passage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West... southwest, Captain Mendez...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steady as she goes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS walks over to FERNANDO, who is leaning against the rail.  He is smoking a cigar... as the smoke blows over FERNANDO'S face, FERNANDO wretches... It's clear he' feeling seasick, trying to control it. COLUMBUS leans against the rail next to him, staring out at the darkness.  Then looks at his SON again.  FERNANDO won't give in to the sickness, but COLUMBUS knows he'd feel better if he did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you feeling, Fernando?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a strangled voice) Not bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS nods meditatively, puffs out some smoke. FERNANDO winces, gags slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost casually) You know what I always used to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FERNANDO shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swallow a piece of pork fat on a string.  It always worked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the thought of the pork fat, FERNANDO jerks his head over the side, and vomits copiously.  COLUMBUS smiles, pats him on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As it plows through heavy seas.  COLUMBUS, a coat wrapped around him, is sitting on a chair topside, directing operations despite an obvious fever. Suddenly a cry from the mast head:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tierra...!  Tierra!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAILORS and FERNANDO rush to the side of the ship, peerin through the spray.  FERNANDO wipes his eyes, and then he sees it:  there in the distance, a speck of land. FERNANDO and his FATHER stand together, watching the low cloud formation sitting on the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mainland...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FERNANDO looks excited.  Discreetly, COLUMBUS watches his SON, enjoying his happiness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A most wonderful and surreal image.  A heavy mist lies over the forest.  We move above it slowly. A FIGURE emerges from the mist.  At first only a silhouette -- then, slowly, a golden figure... an INDIAN, covered in gold... gold artifacts, golden paste on his body. The GOLDEN FIGURE turns, and points, into an unknown distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the INDIAN treehouse, COLUMBUS, FERNANDO, MENDEZ and several INDIANS are gazing west over a necklace of magnificent lakes. The INDIANS point and talk gently.  FERNANDO has never seen anything so fresh, so beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A magnificent sunset.  A fire is burning, food cooking. COLUMBUS looks over his maps, trying to figure out where they are.  We see the outline of the continent of Asia. An OLD INDIAN squats beside him, silent, also looking at the map.  Then, slowly and very deliberately, he takes a piece of charcoal from the fire and begins to draw on the map.  Ignoring the Asian continent, he sketches the Panamanian coastline -- an isthmus.  MENDEZ and FERNANDO gather round.  COLUMBUS watches the OLD INDIAN with initial puzzlement, then growing excitement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's drawing an isthmus... He's saying we're on an isthmus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FERNANDO is still confused.  The OLD INDIAN continues to sketch, talking quietly all the time.  An INDIAN TRANSLATOR listens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me what he's saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says -- water on the other side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask him if he means a lake.  A big lake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TRANSLATOR asks.  The OLD INDIAN shakes his head, laughs, points to the west, way beyond the other lakes, emphatically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Says those are lakes.  Water on other side big -- as wide as here. Above and below, much land.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned) An ocean...?  He's says it's an ocean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS is too stunned for a moment to explain.  The INDIANS laugh. Then COLUMBUS takes the charcoal, and begins to draw on the map, for his son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here is Europe... and over here, the continent of Asia.  But there's something in between!  Another continent!  We've found... another continent!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FERNANDO stares west, then back at his FATHER.  COLUMBUS looks very feverish, his face bathed with sweat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There must be a passage to that other ocean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS, feverish, lies on the bunk.  He shivers violently.  FERNANDO anxiously watches over him, bathes his eyes. Suddenly THE TRANSLATOR enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little reluctantly, FERNANDO lets him go to his FATHER. The INDIAN crouches over the bed, takes out a handful of leaves from a pouch.  He chews the leaves himself for a moment, until they form a sticky pulp, then opens COLUMBUS' mouth and puts the pulp inside, encouraging COLUMBUS to chew with the motions of his hands. COLUMBUS chews, quickly falling asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see things from COLUMBUS' hallucination.  We are plunging through layers of clouds, the speed accelerating giving us a sickening sensation of falling to land, close and closer... COLUMBUS wakes up with a jolt.  Everything is silent. COLUMBUS walks outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS' fever has subsided.  He raises his head and stares at the mainland passing in the night.  He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The roof of the jungle, the bay beyond, the caravel at anchor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two canoes going upstream, deeper and deeper into the jungle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smoke rises lazily above the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boats reaching the bank.  THE FIRST HUTS of a village THE SOLDIERS spread out into the empty village. FERNANDO, COLUMBUS and MENDEZ preceded by TWO ARMED SOLDIERS enter one of the huts.  The remains of a meal is still warm in bowls on the matted floor. A famished SOLDIER dips his hand in one of the bowls and devours its contents:  some kind of stew.  Stepping back accidentally, FERNANDO bumps into a large earthen jar behind him.  It rolls and crashes, revealing the remains of meat marinating in liquid.  There is something disturbing about the appearance of the content.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The remains of human beings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (approaching) What is...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares at the remains, stunned.  THE SOLDIER stops chewing.  He drops the half-empty bowl he was still holding.  He runs at the back door, rams his fingers deep in the back of his throat, and vomits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Virgen Maria... Oh Madre de Dios... (Oh Virgin Mary... Oh Mother of God...)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But as he vomits and cries, he notices: A HEADLESS HUMAN TRUNK spread open, like a sheep carcass. Disturbed flies rise in clouds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Maria, y todos los Santos... (Jesus, Mary, and all the Saints...)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS and the SPANIARDS meet in the center of the village.  All have made the same horrific discovery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (urgently) Out!  Get out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE SPANIARDS back out of the village, crossbows pointed at the invisible enemy hidden in the jungle. They are running through the dense forest for the river bank. The CANNIBALS materialize among the trees, running alongside.  Bounding, skipping, frightening FIGURES, thei brutal faces painted in black.  They release arrows at th running SOLDIERS.  A SOLDIER stops, kneels to the ground, fires his crossbow and kills one of the CANNIBALS... but he is pierced by a spear.  TWO CANNIBALS drag him and cut his throat to finish him.

dialogues.speaker: ELSEWHERE IN THE JUNGLE
dialogues.text: and CANNIBALS moving in hand to hand combat. A CANNIBAL comes sprinting at FERNANDO, brandishing his lance. COLUMBUS jumps on the man, and plants a knife in his abdomen.  Blinded in sweat, he stabs the CANNIBAL, who collapses.  Frenzied, COLUMBUS stabs over and over again. He stops and looks at his forearm -- soaked in blood. Shocked by his own fury, he raises his hand and stares at it. A GIANT BLACK BUTTERFLY alights gently on his bloody fingers, COLUMBUS staring fascinated at its palpitating wings.  FERNANDO, screaming at his FATHER, drags him to his feet.  They run...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE SPANIARDS, COLUMBUS, MENDEZ, FERNANDO... all running hard to the boat.  ARROWS whistle around them as they lea into the canoes, nearly capsizing them, launching them into the current. SOME CANNIBALS still follow them along the riverbank.  Bu the canoes are faster, and soon, they are left behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
