dialogues.text: Endless seascape, the caravel plowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FERNANDO is crouched on the poop deck, wrapped in a blanket.  He seems in a state of shock:  he is pale and shaking.  As COLUMBUS goes and sits near his son, he hand him a flask of alcohol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kindly) Take it.  Come on.  Drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As COLUMBUS insists, brandishing the flask, FERNANDO notices that his hands are shaking too.  His FATHER'S forehead is dripping with sweat. FERNANDO drinks a gulp and grimaces.  He drinks again and hands the flask back to his FATHER, who does the same. FERNANDO notices dried blood on his FATHER'S fingers. COLUMBUS immediately hides his hand and stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I have to see Mendez.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, with sudden anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your brother was right.  I should have never taken you with me.  I'll never forgive myself.  Never!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks a few steps, lurches, and has to lean against th rail.  He raises his hand to his eyes, grimacing in pain, as if they were burning.  FERNANDO scrambles to his feet and rushes to him.  COLUMBUS' eyes are already fixed somewhere -- fever is eating him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you ever forgive me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FERNANDO turns around for help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Mendez!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS is lying on his couch.  FERNANDO is bathing his eyes, sweeping off the pus that continuously forms in them.  COLUMBUS is drenched in sweat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FERNANDO is writing under his FATHER'S dictation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came to Your Highness with honest purpose and sincere zeal.  I did not undertake these voyages for honor or wealth -- that is certain.  After years of service to the Crown, I do not have a roof to put over my head... Your Majesty allowed me to explore the continent, believed to be Asia.  I now believe that it is an new Land, of unknown proportions and wealth... Life has more imagination than we carry in our dreams...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DUENA, sitting beside ISABEL, quietly continues to read COLUMBUS' letter aloud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I should be judged as a Seaman who by Divine Will discovered a New World, and thereby placed it under the sovereignty of Your Majesties. I humbly beseech Your Majesties that if it pleases God to remove me hence, you will help the name of Columbus to be remembered with honor... Weep for me, whoever has charity, truth and justice."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops reading.  ISABEL turns her face away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ivory-sculptured hand -- the end of the back scratcher belonging to AROJAZ -- indicates a line across a large globe:  the route between Europe and America.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sunset route to the new continent is now well-established...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a large amphitheater, filled with PEOPLE attending a lecture of "Nova Geographica" -- the new geography. AROJAZ stands in front of the assembly.  Facing him, enthroned, is KING FERDINAND, surrounded by COURTIERS, including SANCHEZ. We slowly move across the arena, passing attentive faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... West by south west for 750 leagues to Santo Domingo.  From there, west north west, leaving San Juan to the north, reaching the island of Hispanola on the northern cape of San Raphael... Then onto the mainland, at the Cape called Gracias a Dios...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We continue to rise up the tiers of seats...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spain -- by Your Majesty's grace -- has confirmed for all humanity the existence of an unknown continent... Tierra Incognita...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a highest tier, we stop on the face of CHRISTOPHER COLUMBUS, listening impassively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... This continent was first discovered by a sailor commissioned by your Majesty...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON COLUMBUS' eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name... Amerigo Vespucci...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On COLUMBUS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Around the KING, on horseback, surrounded by the KNIGHTS, a CROWD is kept back by SOLDIERS.  AROJAZ is mounting his horse.  SANCHEZ is waiting for him. COLUMBUS stands among the students at the back of the CROWD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AROJAZ rides next to SANCHEZ.  AROJAZ suddenly spots COLUMBUS in the crowd, as they move off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God...!  I thought he was dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pass close enough to touch COLUMBUS.  But he does no see them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can see for yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a tragedy... what a waste of a life...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A waste...?  Let me tell you something, Arojaz.  If your name, or mine, is ever remembered -- it will only be because of his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AROJAZ looks at SANCHEZ in surprise -- then cranes his neck round, and looks back at COLUMBUS -- now a FACE IN THE CROWD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANTONIO DE MARCHENA, a very old man now, is taking a siesta next to his grapes.  He is sitting in a simple armchair, a rosary wrapped around his fingers. The presence of someone wakes him.  After a moment, he recognizes COLUMBUS and smiles.  Both MEN are very moved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose we're both old men now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll always be older than me, Father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They laugh.  COLUMBUS sits down.  Bees drone lazily in th sunlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever forgiven me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCHENA nods his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  I forgave you a long time ago. You see, I was proud of you.  You were like a willful child.  You wouldn't accept what others told you.  You had to find things out for yourself, hurting yourself -- and others -- in the process.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCHENA looks at his plants, sighs contentedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you remember when you said that people talk about the world, but never leave their gardens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More than ever I wonder what it is we do achieve by leaving our gardens... The world changes -- and yet it seems the same.  We find new worlds, but fill them with the same people...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pauses, looks across at COLUMBUS, smiles again gently. MARCHENA, tiring, leans back in his chair, and looks up towards the sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to disagree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew you would.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New worlds create new people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh?  So you are a new man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... I have the impression that I didn't change that much.  I still can't accept the world as it is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCHENA starts laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God bless you, and those like you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FERNANDO is sitting in front of his FATHER, examining documents and letters.  COLUMBUS has wrapped a shawl around his legs.  He looks even older now, with his mass of pure white hair. BEATRIX comes out with a tray, carrying grapes and a decanter of water.  She places it on a small table near COLUMBUS and touches his shoulder. As she is ready to return inside the house, he holds her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you stay with us a little?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am busy inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles.  She looks at him smiling, intrigued.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it, now?  Tell me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't keep my eyes off you.  I would like to catch up with all the moments I didn't spend with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FERNANDO looks up at them above his letters, amused and slightly embarrassed.  COLUMBUS looks at him with a fake air of reproach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you listening to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not listening, Father.  But I can't help hearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FERNANDO opens a letter and reads it quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Diego... He is at the Court, with Santangel... He says they hope to get your privileges restored... And maybe the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS smiles and nods -- all this seems to be of very little importance to him now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But how is he?  And Dona Maria?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FERNANDO continues to read.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, it seems.  Diego is thinking of starting a pearl trade, in Santo Domingo... He says he received many letters for you.  Some of your men, mostly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens one of them, glances at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one is from Mendez!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS' eyes brighten with joy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He asks when he can come to visit you.  He left his address.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) He never had one... except aboard my ships!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FERNANDO laughs -- then, suddenly serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to tell me everything you remember, Father.  From the beginning.  Everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? (pause) God... I wouldn't know where to start... and yet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me the first thing that comes to your mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS sighs, and leans back on his chair.  His eyes ar fixed somewhere, searching.  Then, almost in a murmur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the page.  FERNANDO writes: ... I REMEMBER... A drop of ink falls from the quill onto the page and the words. FERNANDO is waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLUMBUS' eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MOVING IMAGE, as seen from the rolling deck of a ship. We see: A majestic forest, resting on a slash of white sand, and deep blue sea...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE LONE SILHOUETTE of an INDIAN emerges from the dense foliage.  He runs down the beach towards the surf.  He stops and seems to be staring at us. These words appear on the screen: THE BIOGRAPHY FERNANDO WROTE ABOUT HIS FATHER WAS FOUND BY CHANCE IN VENICE.  ITS PUBLICATION IN 1571 CONTRIBUTED TO RESTORING THE NAME OF CHRISTOPHER COLUMBUS, WHICH HAD BEEN FORGOTTEN. IN 1511 DIEGO COLUMBUS BECAME GOVERNOR OF SANTO DOMINGO. COLUMBUS RESTS IN THE CATHEDRAL OF SEVILLE, IN ANDALUSIA.
